Reviews.Author: Quiltndollmaker
Reviews.Content: Ok, I am not a techno wizard who "roots" what ever that is. I am a Mom with a passion for quilting and sewing who just wanted a tablet for a great price. I don't give a flip about having to have the latest Apple product and I own an Android phone. So, the direction for me was simple. I did a lot of research though because I am on a budget. I kept seeing the same name pop up in many reveiws for the Le Pan II so I researched it at length. It seemed to have all the features I needed and many I have no idea what to do with. I have had my Le Pan II for three weeks so here's what I know:1. The battery life is great lasting for many hours playing the free music from Google while I sew! I simply search for music I enjoy, download, and play! So very easy! But, I did follow directions and charge the tablet for 8 hours before using the first time.2. The on/off button is easy to use if you follow the directions of holding it down for a few seconds when it has been turned off. Hold it down a short second if it's just sleeping.3. Connecting to Wifi was a breeze and seamless...I just followed the prompts.4. It has amazing map accuracy but unlike my phone it has to be connected Wifi to get the Google Maps.5. I have no idea what light spillage or dead pixels are but I don't think I have any. It has never locked up and plays videos with out pausing.6. The sound is very clear and loud even nested inside the Targus Case.7. I find the serial plug into the tablet works just fine and because it has USB charging/wall plug I can plug it into my lap top to transfer documents and pdf sewing files.8. I could have bought it from Best Buy but the price was better on Amazon.9. The instruction page that comes with it is very brief but I printed out the Pdf instruction file and it covers a the rest and is easy to read and follow.10. This tablet is super fast and responsive and so far it has surpassed my expectations.Anyway, I have surfed the internet, bloged, watched videos, read Pdf files, books, have checked all my Email accounts on one page for easy viewing, I am still learning new things this tablet can do.
Reviews.Title: Perfect for me!

Reviews.Author: Pink Breadsticks
Reviews.Content: Update after 6 months:Use of this quadrupled by many more friends and family members. I can never keep the battery charged long enough to use it myself. So the charger cable finaly wore out a month back and it was easily and quickly replaced free of charge with no hassle by the manufacturer. The new cable is designed better and I feel it should last for years. Customer service is beyond compare. And here is the real deal that makes this the best tablet you can buy. I came home a while back and my tablet screen was shattered. I dreaded what that meant for my family. Hey we lost our pride and joy here. I contacted the manufacturer in the hopes of purchasing a replacement screen and be able to afford the cost. I feared the cost would be near as much as a new tablet. The company never even asked me what happened or offered me options for repair service. They just said " no problem"  "send it back" "we'll send you a new one" and they did rather super fast and I will be forever loyal to this manufacturer. Any other product they produce will become a member of my household. Now imagine any other tablet pc competitor when you call and tell them you have a cracked screen? Better have your cedit card ready huh?My opinion is based upon daily heavy use of this tablet pc. When I say heavy use, I mean many different users of all ages & experience for many hours at a time. And in all types of environments. This tablet has been stepped on, dropped, rained on, and even jumped on by the family pet. It has been operated at high & low temperatures.Now my initial reaction, not ever having much experience with a full touchscreen tablet pc (only my phone) was amazing. The thing that amazed me the most, (and still does) is the ability to have the whole world in the palm of your hands or fingertips with GoogleEarth. It was the best app I downloaded. Even my aged relatives who have been technilogically impaired or scared of computers took right to this thing and didn't want to give it back. There was no need for dexterity with a mouse since their fingers controlled the action.As for battery life, I realized with more use the battery seemed to drain more and more quickly after the first 2 weeks. But now at 6 weeks the battery seems to have found some new life and is holding up better than when first used. Although I must say I do not like the heat generated by the charger. It gets too warm for my tatse so I continually have to keep a check on the plug while charging.Also, I realized as an added bonus that my Motorola Karma pc cord fit perfectly in the charger base and allowed me to charge my phone with no issues.As stated by another user there was a ghost light up in the upper top left corner of my screen upon initial use. This light has spread somewhat and a new ghost light has showed up in the opposite corner after 4 weeks of use. It has to be quality control issue when the screen was sealed since I also have 2 tiny black specks sealed into my screen from the factory. Maybe they made these things too fast or for whatever reason, it's internal operating system makes up for the blemishes.It opens, streams, and downloads movies, webpages etc FASTER than my Sony Vaio PC. I have never experienced such instant speed while surfing the net. I noticed I was continually losing wi-fi connection but determined it not related to the tablet since all tests from other wi-fi sources in the house lost connection at the same time.Applications install & unistall instantly with no effort or trouble. I love how you open your fingers to make pages, words, or photos larger or squeeze them together to make smaller. And that you can have more than one home screen. Even though it's not actually a phone you can make calls via google talk and even video calls which we tested. Awesome!I found a case Lucky Brand Ipad Silicone & Flip book Style that fit this perfectly. The silicone case has a notch I cut out for the charger port and it made my day!I agree the power button is too small and very annoying and hard to operate. But now that I have this, I wouldn't trade it for nothing! I don't think I have been interested in the desktop or laptop since this arrived. Actually I never thought about using anything else to connect once I used this thing. It's brilliantly designed, inexpensive compared to other tablets, user friendly, loveable, and so much fun!Maybe if it was an official ipad the kids wouldn't have been allowed to carry it around so much or it wouldn't have been left in the middle of the floor. But then it would have been put high on a hog, and always been taboo for our family. This thing becasue of it's price was treated differently and in so doing allowed us to realize it full potential and worth! So when it was stepped on we cringed, but didn't get hysterical. When it was left in the rain we gasped but didn't lose our breath. When it was dropped on the concrete time stood still but we didn't seem to notice. And when the dog jumped on it and tried to dig a hole in the screen we just laughed and patted him on the head! Honestly, it has held up well and suffered no visible damage. So when the kids come in from their mud fight and want to use the tablet to take a pic of themselves I'll be sure to wash it off along with children afterwards!
Reviews.Title: 6wks Heavy Use Review! Very Surprised! 6mo w/ update

Reviews.Author: Ted Rosauro
Reviews.Content: With specs close to the Ipad, the LePan TC970 is an excellent buy for half the price. And now that Walmart has a price rollback, I made the decision to compliment my smartphone with a tablet. The biggest difference between these two gadgets is the screen size and resolution, everything looks bigger and more visible on the tablet. But that comes at a price of portability, it is meant to be used indoors and sunlight will make the screen totally unviewable. But other than some minor complaints, this table is worth every penny.Here's a list or pros and cons that I've managed to collect in the short period of usage, I've spent most of it downloading apps and enjoying the new features and capabilities of my new toy. One reason I bought this is to install the Skype software which provides for voice and video conversations throughout the world. So with that said, let's go on with the list:Pros, The Good:Price - Amazon's price beats everyone.Quality - Much, much better than the cheap competition.Size - Just right and very slick, the dust cloth comes in handy.Ipad Screen - The 9.7 screen and 1024x768 res is a standard for tablets.Fast Wifi - Wireless connection and speed are both easy and fast.Working GPS - No antenna cables here, the built in chip works like the phones.Working Bluetooth - Great for pairing headphones and file transfers.512mb memory - Not the stingy 256mb found on other models.2g internal memory - More apps to load, no more out of memory messages.32g SD card max - You want more storage, just buy a 32g micro sdhc and you're set.AccelerometerAmbient light sensorFront facing camera and microphone for video call/chat.Settings behind status bar dropdown, very convenient.2g internal storage expands non-SD apps capacity. A big plus for apps that cannot move to SD.Ambient light sensor controls screen brightness. Saves the battery.Screen is very sensitive to the touch, a fly could probably land on it and cause unpredictable results.Most apps designed for the Ipad will probably feel at home on the LePan because of the same screen and resolution.Cons, The Bad:No manual, learn by trial and error. I haven't checked the [..] website yet.Very narrow handles cause fingers to touch sensitive screen.Accidental hit of back button very annoying. Wish those handles would extend out for better grip.Comand button lights not controlled by ambient light sensor, hard to see in the dark.SDHC chip slot location very awkward, huge closure tab gets in the way. Bad design.Hardware buttons are not labeled, must grope to locate.Back button should not be too sensitive to the touch, it will exit the app in progress. Extremely annoying.Still lack compatibility with some tablet apps due to hardware and software differences. Mostly video games that demand faster graphics chips like the Nvidia Tegra. Also the later version of the Android OS provides more features found in more expensive tablets.
Reviews.Title: Great Gift For The Holidays

Reviews.Author: CK "CK"
Reviews.Content: This tablet is great but has WiFi issues.  Tried on several networks, always connects way slower than all other devices on same network.Youtube is especially painful.  On a friend's network, me having this tablet and my friend having an Ipod, we started at the same time the same Youtube video (me in standard definition 360p, and my friend in HD).  She was almost done with the HD video, and I was still in endless initial buffering of my 360p version.I would love to love this tablet, but what's the point if WiFi is not working well.Buyer beware! I hope they fix it, and may buy another one at that point.Here is their answer to my ticket; they acknowledge at least that some users are reporting this :Case Subject: Slow WiFiUpdate Date: 1/25/2012 11:00:47 AMComments from LePan Support:Dear ******,We are working hard to get Wi Fi connection and Bluetooth connection problems solved. We are unable to duplicate the problem at the factory. We are asking customers to send Le Pan II with the connection problem back to us asap. So we can study the unit(s) to locate the problems.Thank You.
Reviews.Title: Great tablet, but problem with WiFi.

Reviews.Author: fmarullo
Reviews.Content: I have owned this for about a week.  It is a very nice unit, I especially like the microphone button built into the virtual keyboard.  I bought this for my son, I have an iPad2.  This does everything the iPad2 does except perform well on the network.  As a senior engineer of XXX, I am well schooled in WiFi and understand the technology.  I have tested the throughput on 4 different Access points.  What I notice is that when connected, the connection speed rarely matches the actual connection speed ( not a problem with other devices). As an example it will show 1Mbs when in fact my iPad2, my 2 lenovo laptops and my HP laptop all connect at 54Mps.  Even when it does connect at 54Mbps, the actual throughput using several tools and test sites ( speedtest.com / speakeasy.com / Vudu speedtest...) rarely exceeds 1 MBps.  In fact, the upload speed is normally faster.  I read through the FAQs, spoke to LePan tech support, this is not an issue on my end.  I have tried WEP, WPA ( I would not reccomend this- the Le Pan does not see a constant signal vis WiFi alalyzer available from amazon marketplace) LEAP and open.  All exhibit the same on both my home and work networks.  I have on occasion seen it spike to 5-6MPs, but it is rare and I cannot pin point what it is that allows it to occasionally ( 1-25 maybe connects) to download at the capability of the access point and network allow.  I spent 10 hours changing settings, routers, turning off GPS, encryption, channels, downloading updates, stood next to the Access point, you name it, I tried it.  I sure hope they fix this as its is a clear winner for the price ( I did not but it through Amazon as they are on backorder).If you don't care about streaming high quality video and connection speed is unimportant- you cannot go wrong with this.  As another person pointed out, the CaseCrown case fits perfect and is on sale now.  I cannot give this the 5 stars it deserves becuase of this poor download speed issue, it is a deal breaker for me.  IF Le Pan does not come through before my 30 day window is up, I will be returning this for another brand.  Its inexcusable to offer a new product when the original had WiFi connection issues and now this one suffers from WiFi performance issues.  Who tests this stuff?  Answer, you and me.
Reviews.Title: Nice but has WiFi download performance issues...

Reviews.Author: Detlef K.
Reviews.Content: Well, I was really excited about this tablet when I found it online. All the reviews looked good and so I decided to buy me one.Here is from my point of view the good and the bad:Pros:- very nice touch screen with good contrast and brightness- intuitive user interface- good touchscreen response- excellent mechanical built and nice design- nice set of apps factory installed [browser, email, gallery =, etc.]- micro SD card memory extension, which is completely accessible via USB- nice video playback- easy WiFi setupCons:- mediocre WiFi sensitivity compared at same location [e.g. poor on the tablet vs. good on my laptop]- multiple dead pixels in the display- the current OS only supports 4bit per pixel images which leads to heavy banding in photographs- comes with only 2GB SD memory installedIt's a nice tablet for the money but there are some improvements needed. Hopefully they provide an upgrade to the OS soon. I guess the dead pixels on the display come with the rather low price point. Something's gotta give.Hope this helps to make your buying decision. Not sure if I'm going to keep it because I want use it mostly for my photography portfolio and there the dead pixels and the 4bit make things a bit ugly.
Reviews.Title: Very nice tablet with some flaws ...

Reviews.Author: Lisa Colvin
Reviews.Content: After doing tons of research on LOTS of different tablets I decided on this on.  I was only wanting to spend around 300 on a Tablet..it was starting to look like a lost cause finding one that would do/have everything I wanted for that price.  Then I found this LE PAN 2!!!!  I'm soo thankful for all the reviewers here on Amazon for their wonderful reviews...you guys rock!!!  I see NO reason to spend a couple hundred more bucks on any other tablet and this one will do it all.My le pan came in yesterday and I did what lots of peeps suggested...let it charge completely before trying it out.  I never would have thought this tablet would be so resonpsive.  I touch something and instantly it does it.  The touch screen is right on.  I'm using it now to write this review...even on Amazons small search box, tapped it one time and it hit it right on.  The keyboard has no lag time, I type it does it.Switching between websites is just as fast as with my laptops.  Every web page I've thrown at it, it loads it right up.  I'm not having any of the WiFi issues that others are talking about.  Every time I've checked my connection it was on 54m...only one time it showed 36, but both my kids were on their computers watching YouTube vids, so don't know if that had anything to di with it or not??The android market is great!! Lots of free games/ apps on there.  They all downloaded as as fast as my iPod does apps with iTunes.  I tried a few YouTube vids myself on this and only one of them stopped to buffer one time...not a problem...press pause wait a bit then resume...no biggie!!Used the connector that came with it to hook it up to my laptop to see about adding some music...no problems there..loaded right up.  Haven't tried any loading any movies onto it yet though..not really sure what format they should be in??  Is it mp4??  If someone knows, please leave me a comment to let me know.I really don't see why people are complaining about the finger prints on this tablet...I mean, really...it IS a touch screen...it's going to get your prints all over it.  It only takes a few seconds to wipe it clean.Again, most of their more negative reviews for this tablet is because of WiFi issues...I have had none...so not for sure what the problem is for others??All in all a great tablet..if you can get your hands on it...Buy one!!!!
Reviews.Title: Great Tablet!!!

Reviews.Author: simplerRev
Reviews.Content: First off just let me say I have been wanting to get my hands on a tablet for months after my girlfriend got an IPad 2.  I thought about getting one for myself but didn't want to spend a min of $500.00.  So I did my research and LUCKILY came across the Le Pan original.  I was very pleased with the original but withen a few days I realized the Le Pan II release was near and I really wanted the newer Android 3.2 software.  So I returned it and pre-ordered the Le Pan II.I recieve it 2 days ago.  And...I absolutley love it!  Cosmetically it is a very attractive tablet to say the least.  The screen is sharp, web browing is quick and easy.  Videos stream clear and fast.  I love the fact that the adroid market offers so many free apps for pretty much anything you are looking for.My Conclusion of the matter is:I would rather have this tablet over an Ipad and it was 50% cheaper than the least expensive IPad 2 on the market as I got mine for $250.00. The Le Pan II tablet is the one of the best kept secrets in the tablet world today, but I don't expect that to stay the same for long.
Reviews.Title: Can't beat this tablet for price!!!

Reviews.Author: mdotson
Reviews.Content: I am the owner of several android devices including a Nook Color and a gtablet. After owning The Le Pan TC 970 for about a month I can say this device is a steal compared to other tablets and a real performer. The screen is easily the best I have tested with a superior viewing angle that puts many of the majors such as Xoom, Acer Icona, and HP touchpad to shame. Does everything I want with ease. Only cons I have are minor and easily fixed if the company wants to do so. Android 2.2, only 500mb internal ram with 2GB sd card, and screen locked in landscape mode on Home Screen. I upgraded to a 16GB sd card so now have ample storage, and flashed a new firmware from the maker that improved screen responsiveness even more. Bottom line, this is a VERY GOOD and reasonable priced tablet I would recommend to everyone. Maker says they are going to upgrade to Ice Cream Sandwich early next year, but I would have preferred Android 2.3 Gingerbread
Reviews.Title: Le Pan a bargain

Reviews.Author: kamkar1
Reviews.Content: The store meet it's requirements and the device was delivered on time. Worked the first time out of box.The device delivered on it's promises, to be fair it's a good product, good image quality, and fast.I used it during my recent travel overseas and with free wifi (almost anywhere), you had instant access to maps, email, and phone (Google voice or Skype).What's lacking-1- The Le Pan website is very weak and does not have enough information to help you resolve your issues, so there is a bit of feeling - "left out in the cold"2- Camera worked for the first week, after I installed a 16G SD card, the image is red, yellow and blue, have not found a solution.3- I would like to reinstall the operating system and there is no instructions.cheers
Reviews.Title: Good product - lacks support

Reviews.Author: K. Weber "kara weber"
Reviews.Content: I recieved the le pan tablet a few days ago and have been on it nonstop! I am actually writing this review on the tablet now. It is great for online banking, shopping, games and pretty much anything you can think of. As others have said this product worked great right out of the box. I didnt even have to charge it for a few hours. I am a student, so i have taken this tablet to school. Every wifi i have connected it with so far has given me zero problems. The only problems i have had, or not even really large issues at all  are that the tanlet only comes with one wall charger, the fingerprints are definitely annoying(although i am going to order the screen protector today for this tablet, if you do not like an excessive amount of fingerprints then ordering the screen protector is a must for you, ive also read very good reviews about the screen protector specifically made for this tablet), and the tanlet does not have a usb port. Although this is not a bigissue at all, because i learned that my ipod usb cord works perfectly with this tablet. I wanted to order the leather case with the keyboard that amazon recommends buying for this tablet, but i believe the keyboard is only compatible with a usb port. Although it should work with the ipod cord, so i may order that soon as well. Overall, the tablet is a great product and i only paid 168 for it after signing up for an amazon credit card i got 30 dollars off of the sale price. What a steal! You wont be dissappointed if your just looking for a great basic tablet with millions of apps, tools, and so much more.
Reviews.Title: good tablet for the price!

Reviews.Author: Zebramall
Reviews.Content: I have had the Le Pan tablet for 3 days and I know that is kind of quick to make a judgement but I had to make a review. I am actually contemplating returning the unit, it has a bright spot of light about 1/4" wide on the screen in the left center of screen like the tft screen is worn away there, so starting off with a defect. I come pre-biassed because I bought a Asus EEE Transformer Honeycomb tablet and ordered the base laptop for it. I was online and saw this, because I could not justify spending almost $600 on a tablet + base so I was going to return the ASUS. However after comparing the 2 I have to say the ASUS wins hands down. The ASUS is only $399 (without base), this one is $349. I do not like Honeycomb and thought I would get a tablet with Froyo but the ASUS screen is SO MUCH MORE CRISP. I will say the screen is very crisp and has VERY wide viewing angles on the Le Pan, but any video I play I see pixilation and bluryness as the processor is not a dual core. The quality of the resolution on the Le Pan is not as good. I do have a fast N connection and get better video on other tablets. The ASUS pad has it's own issues with video and I hate Honeycomb so far, but I cannot justify spending $50 less and getting a tablet (Le Pan) that is NOT widescreen (9.7) 4:3 ratio and so far has no real history or support. I dont want to be stuck with a tablet that 6 months down the road, the company will not exist or support updates. I will say the unit does play Angry Birds well, so other games should not be a issue. As others have said Netflix does not play out of the box. The few things this tablet has going for it, is long battery life, GREAT viewing angles, it DOES fit most generic ipad cases very well and it is fairly light with good build quality. I dont know why they chose to put the charger port at the top of the unit though. Overall the unit is good if you just want something that works and fairly good quality that mimics the ipad shape. I however think I will stick with the more known companies products right now.
Reviews.Title: Nice entry level Unit with flaws

Reviews.Author: Randy B
Reviews.Content: Barely used this since buying it. Tried it last week and discovered it was "frozed". Tried everything including hitting reset, power button, both at same time, etc.Spent 30 minutes today (again) trying to reach someone in customer support to get a RMA # to return it for warranty work. Same recorded message ran over and over so their customer support is non existence in my opinion.Do not waste your money on this item or buy anything from this company. I plan on sending it back without a RMA number and going from there as I have nothing to lose at this point.UPDATE: Tried a few more times to reach Le Pan with the same results, nothing. Tried emailing them for a RMA number, no reply. Contacted Amazon and they told me to send it back and they will send me a new one! Great customer service from Amazon but that doesnt change my mind about Le Pan's product or customer service (or lack of).
Reviews.Title: No customer support - froze up

Reviews.Author: Walter Sr
Reviews.Content: ***** Final Update 8/09/2012- I shipped my tablet back to LePan. It cost me 18.00 to return on 7/18/12. I received the replacement tablet on 8/07. I up-grade to platform to ICS on 08/08/12. Afterwards I noticed that the tablet would drop the Wi-Fi signal every 10 minutes or so. Honestly I did not play with it long enough before upgrading to ICS to noticed if the problem already existed. Informed Lepan, they sent me a checklist of items to check. None them fixed the issue. I am done. I am going to let my son play with it. Good luck if you make the purchase. Personally, I would get a refurbished Samsung for 299.00 if I could have a do over.***** Update 7/1/2012- DOS- it would not start-up today. wow...I am so disappointed!!! I should have listened to all of the negative reviews. Just found out that Amazon has a lot of vendors taking advantage of their rating systems. They actually give people incentives to give false (4 and 5 star) reviews on their products. Absolutely terrible!!! AMAZON PLEASE figure out away to stop those crooks. I rely heavily on Amazons rating system. It appears I have been hood winked :(****- Update 6/12/2012- A small glitch has developed with the battery charge indicator. It does not reflect the actual state of charge and constantly reads to be at 50%. I have also noticed that when the battery is low the stability of the tablet began to flicker and freeze.There is an update (firmware?) for the tablet posted at the website. I am going to back up my files onto my micro Sd card and install the update. I will let you know how it works.I still think this tablet is the best bang for the bucks, and would rate it a 4.5. It really serves me well. I love looking a Netflix on it, reading books (purchased a 7.00 anti-glare screen), and video chatting with the kids.****** Just what I needed. I purchased my tablet on Feb 3rd and received it around the 10th. I decided to wait a little while before making any comment to see if the tablet might produce some glitches after regular use. So far there have been no glitches noticed.I originally owned the Samsung 7 inch G-tab. The Samsung had all the bells a whistles but the reduced screen size was a major disadvantage for me because I wanted to use my tablet to read from during sermons and speeches. My first experience with the Android tablets revealed that the tablet functions were basically the same as my android cell phone. They basically will not do anymore than your phone is capable of doing (just a larger screen). The tablet really doesn't work well (for me) when trying to produce projects like papers, art, video editing, spread sheets, or Power Points. You can do some manipulations on projects, but nothing serious. The biggest advantage of the tablet for me is portability, screen size verses a phone, gaming, reading, videos, and making presentations. Armed with this knowledge I sat out to find the best tablet for the money.After hours of research (in my humble opinion) the La Pad tablet is by far the best for my wants. The picture quality is above reproach. The processing speed outstanding. The screen resolution... fantastic. The 4.3 screen layout is preferred over the 16.9 aspect ratio, unless you are looking at a movie. Basically, what I am trying to say is that this tablet will serve you just as well if not better than any other at twice the cost.Last words...I would advised you to educate your self before making any purchase. Write down the most important purposes for your purchase, determine if it can really do what you need it to do and to the extent needed, and then find the best product for your hard earned dollar.
Reviews.Title: Great Tablet for 4 months

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Everything good that has been written about this tablet is true, but ....the firmware implementation of WIFI communications is not robust. With the nice new routers at my house and several friends houses it performs great. The router at work with a T1 and strong signal but older protocol- passable. But several tested Starbucks and McDonalds-- no go after the first time-----Kept trying to get an IP address; fail, and then cycle thru trying over and over. My other two devices and everyone else in the joints had zero problem. Went back home and it was great. Problem-- I need a tablet I can travel with and depend on to get email, directions, reservations, etc. The first order of business for mobile device is connectability to the existing cyberworld and everything needs to follow from that. I love this tablet but it has to go back. No help from manufacturer but expected none. Thank goodness for Amazon. Seriously bummed; there are some very nice things in the implementation of this tablet.
Reviews.Title: Wonderful, but....

Reviews.Author: Tameka C. Robinson "love amazon"
Reviews.Content: Now I must admit that I had a hard time waiting for this tablet to be delivered, however, I must say without hesitation that IT WAS WORTH THE WAIT.  I love it, love it, love it.The tablet is super smooth and is very responsive.  I had no problem jumping in and setting everything up right out of the box.  Video steaming is fast and the screen is vibrant.  It is so responsive I am almost afraid I would do something wrong,lol.For the money I must say that the other android tablets should watch out as Le pan has officially made itself a contender.  I am in loving this tablet. In fact I am typing my review on it.THE BADI found that there are certain apps that will not work with honeycomb at least from what I have gathered not yet.  I was really disappointed when I went to the market to download HBO GO, and MAX GO and they were no where to be found,  however after a little research I found out that they were not compatable with honeycomb. I guess they are working it it.BACK TO GOODWith that said I must admit that it is an amazing tablet.  Its fast, responsive,  oh yeah and it automatically corrects my spelling when I type, whey 2 go Le Pan.  Can't wait to upgrade to ice cream sandwich.If you weren't sure if you wanted to get this tablet, take my advice don't think about it do it, do it right now.
Reviews.Title: Le Pan II is rocking the house

Reviews.Author: ANON123
Reviews.Content: I've used IOS for years.not even kidding.. i wouldnt touch an android.. and i came across this 1. it has that HUGE display, which i was after.. and 2. it was alot cheaper then a 600 dollar ipad.. and i can change the memory whenever i want..Battery is good.Except it was real funky when i just got it, i did everything to drain it, so i can let it charge over night to get a full cycle in.. now its WONDERFUL!. it was a pain in the ass though yesterday.. i was playing super mario 64 on a NINTENDO 64 emulator.. N64oid and it took FOREVER to die lol.. like heavy usage.. sound all the way up and brightness and i got an easy 6 hours on it.. ( my girlfriend played too, im not a super loser)but everything is pretty cool on this, you get the full android market..and it fits my iphone wires..and from what im seeing, its working with all ipad accessories ..IM A HAPPY CUSTOMER..I KNOW ITS NOT APPLE, MOTOROLA, LIKE A BIG NAMED THING..BUT I PROMISE, THIS IS A .. HIDDEN GEM..
Reviews.Title: mhm. coming from an apple fan boy..

Reviews.Author: Valiant
Reviews.Content: First off, I'm sorry but I am not going to shell out $500+ For a tablet computer.  That is the biggest reason I purchased the Le Pan because it was less than half the price.  It is a similar size to the iPad and I like its size compared to the smaller 7 inch tablets.  It feels more substantial and has a solid build quality.  You can  use it to run Netflix, Amazon Prime videos, and it runs just fine on other video sites like Youtube.The biggest complaint that I've seen about this tablet is that it is running Android 2.2 (one of the most stable of the Android operating systems) and that it cannot be upgraded.  Initially that worried me too until I started looking at the Android marketplace and found that most Android apps and games will run on Android version 1.x .  I had to think to myself that by the time Android 2.2 becomes outdated, I'll be able to buy another more current tablet again for around $200 or so bucks and still have paid less than $600+ today for a 32gb iPad 2 which will also be obsolete by the time my Le Pan is...hmmm...makes sense to me to own this tablet with an upgraded 32GB mini SD card for under $250 than to pay over double that price for an iPad or any of the other 32 GB Android tablets currently on the market that are priced much higher.This tablet easily handles email, video, music , android games, and microsoft office applications with an office app.  I'm even writing this review by speaking it into the android speak to text application.  I do not know of another tablet that can do everything this one can for this low of price and I searched everywhere.By the way, it's awesome to have a tablet in standby mode (It can go a couple days in standby before needing recharged) that you can quickly turn on to jump online or check email!  For the money it really is a no-brainer.  If you want to switch out the micro SD card for a larger one,(comes with a small 2GB card)just copy the contents of the 2GB card onto one that is up to 32Gb in size and voilla you're ready to go.Also the Targus Truss Leather Carrying Case for Apple iPad works well with the Le Pan if you're looking for a cover that fits well, plus it has a built in stand.
Reviews.Title: Doing what a Tablet Should

Reviews.Author: David P. Murray "ninjadave"
Reviews.Content: Similar to some of the folks who bought this, worked fine for first year and 6 months. now i have the dreaded LE PAN logo that just blinks and it won't boot up. Reset, restart, recharge, etc. has not worked. the unit did work nicely up to this point. wifi was not bad, however, the screen response was slow and Andriod 2.3 was not very robust.This is a classic case of you get what you pay for and for some, it still runs, for others it has failed much sooner than mine did so i guess, all in all, i should be happy with 1.5 years but I'm not. Buyer beware. can't comment on the newer unit LEPAN II but if you have $200+ to spend, spend the extra $100-200 and get a Samsung or an IPad mini, etc. Even the Kindle HD Fire is a better option i would think....update: 6/1/13go here. you can reboot this thing if you get this issue. its working again, however all the data is gone but its good to have it back again.http://www.forum.lepanlife.com/thread-1678-post-19276.html#pid19276
Reviews.Title: Dead after 1 year and 6 months

Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: Great product: We use our Le Pan II tablet every day, and it is a great Android tablet at a reasonable price.Excellent customer service: The touch screen on our tablet died about 11 and a half months after we purchased it. Since it was still within the 12 month warranty period, we read the instructions on the support Web site, requested an RMA number by telephone (they call it "Incident ID"), emailed a copy of the purchase receipt for proof of purchase, and sent the tablet back to the service center. About a week later, we received a brand new tablet, boxed with all the accessories included. We couldn't expect better warranty service than that.
Reviews.Title: Great Tablet, Excellent Customer Service

Reviews.Author: Brice H
Reviews.Content: The TC 970 Is a great device, so long as you can live with its flaws. (And it does have them) this device is very prone to Freezing. There is a reset button on the back of the device under power that will get you running again.Sometimes you might run into an issue with it freezing if you connect it to your pc (Also Your PC will not charge your device it must be from the 2.0A wall charger an ipad charger outputs about the same and a ipad cable can work if you shave down alittle of the plastic sides ON THE END OF THE CABLE not the device alternatively inside the power jack on the lepan there is a tiny metal tab that you can bend back and the normal ipad cable will fit without shaving anything.) If you go under settings/application/development and check mark (Stay Awake) that should stop it from freezing from usb to pc hookup.Some users have had the device go to sleep and not want to turn back on (Sometimes the lepan needs you to press and hold the power button the hit the reset before releasing the power) under settings/display/screen timeout set it to 30 minutes and put it to sleep manually.For those of you who now have a paper weight (Device won't turn on no matter what and you're out of warranty) this device seems to have a weak battery jack. My lepan was second hand and I was having all sorts of issues (Device was freezing it would not charge fast/right had problems turning on etc.) I decided just to check the battery. So I got a little Philips head and flat head screw driver (Under the micro sd tab THERE ARE TWO SCREWS THAT MUST BE REMOVED carefully disconnect the back cover from the lepan I find the far end (Away from the power button) to be the easiest place for me to start (The hold switch and volume key can come out so be careful) the battery jack is located on the side the power button is. Mine must have come loose in transit it was a full quarter inch out of the socket after pushing it back in and putting a small piece of electrical tape over it my Lepan worked much better did not freeze as much charged and power on like it was suppose to.I don't know why this device freezes so much. It does seem related to the wifi in some way, does not freeze nearly as much with wifi turned off. Anyway I hope this review helps some fellow Le Pan TC 970 users, most of this info comes from me spending hours searching through forums.
Reviews.Title: Not for newbie

Reviews.Author: cbooth66 "cbooth66"
Reviews.Content: I am enjoying my le pan tc970. This is my first tablet and is very easy to use. The processor is snappy. The quality of the screen is very good. I am writing this to you using the speech recognition on my tablet. The battery life is excellent. I have not put it down since I got it. I highly recommend you purchasing this product.
Reviews.Title: love it!

Reviews.Author: AmandaB
Reviews.Content: I've had the Le Pan II for over a month now and still loving it. My husband and I did a lot of research to find the best tablet at a reasonable price, and now we agree with all of the other positive reviewers saying this is the one. Sensitivity of touch screen is great, operates very smoothly and quickly. Perfect sized screen, decent sized storage (I have tons of apps, etc already and haven't yet had to buy a card for extra memory). Happy with the battery life - I've played around with it all day without running it completely out.  No problems with wifi connection.The only con I have (mentioned by other reviewers) is the volume button, which isn't quickly accessible, but that's just nitpicking.I love this tablet, love the price, happy I bought it!
Reviews.Title: Love it

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "ericatdallas"
Reviews.Content: First, for it's price this is a pretty decent tablet. However, price is not all that matters with these things and it really depends on what you use it for and overall quality.I don't regret the purchase, but people who are used to consumer ready products and don't like to hack, figure things out, etc should stick with Galaxy or iPad.Advantages:- Great price- Solid qualityDisadvantage:- Lack of accessories. Even basic ones such as USB OTG or HDMI connector.- Touchscreen sometimes has trouble with pattern unlock (this may be more my product or my fingers though)- Lacks back camera (I didn't think this would be a problem, but it's something I would like to see). I knew this buying it though and it's negated with the price.General:This is very well built. I'm pleased with the way it feels and it works as I expected (if you have an android phone, it's basically a big giant phone). I had no problems installing Android Applications. Any disadvantages with the software are inherent with the software and not with the tablet.The manufacturer's website is very sparse with information. If you want any significant information you have to search for it and find what others have to say about it.Performance:I use it mostly for PDF reading. It's pretty slow for large files on any number of reading devices. However, it displays small files very well. I use it for double column journal articles and it's big enough (for me) to read it in "fit screen mode." This is true of both Adobe Reader, Aldiko, and one other reader I forgot the name of and have since uninstalled.I installed an unofficial version of VLC player (noneon version) and it works great. No complaints there.Software:It's pretty bare... but that's how I like it. Unlike my Samsung Epic 4G, it's not filled with bloatware and I can install many of them.This is a big plus for me and I've installed all the applications I normally like without any bugs.Applications (known) that I use that work great: Google Voice, Skype, Kindle Reader, Aldiko, Facebook, Firefox, eBay, VLC, Tivo, Wikipedia.The Adobe Reader does strange things when you change stretch/zoom in view settings. For me, if I change it while reading a PDF it escapes out and goes back to the main adobe file selection screen. This may be software though.Networking:It doesn't accept ad hoc connection (unless you root it). I found out this is common to most mobile devices not just Le Pan. The device doesn't seem to have a problem finding my network at home but it does seem to have a hard time finding new networks when I go to Starbucks, Barnes and Nobles, etc (or other restaurant with free Wifi). It's not a huge problem, but it takes a while to find new networks.Bluetooth is slow... It's slower transferring files than my Samsung Epic 4G and a Treo. However, I don't do much with Bluetooth anyway and the mouse I installed works fine and was easy to install.Accessories:Horrible support. This is a relatively new product and it's not from one of the big manufacturers, but it misses some of the basic accessories that they should have made pre-launch. I can say this because I'm an electrical engineer and I've checked their the circuit diagram they submitted to FCC,... there should be no reason they shouldn't have had their HDMI adapter ready at launch.Does not have a 30-pin connector to USB connector. I would have liked to see them come outAlso, regarding accessories, they are difficult to find. You have to send an e-mail to customer support and pay $10 shipping to receive a cable.Their products aren't compatible with any other tablet device. Some iPod chargers work if you shave a piece of plastic off though.Summary:Overall, if you can do without the HDMI or connecting to external USB devices this is an excellent product. The company promises to bring these out, but many new companies break promises. With the Le Pan TC970, they said it would be upgradeable to Honeycomb and now they say it will not be available.
Reviews.Title: Good for the price... but might consider something else if I could change my mind...

Reviews.Author: Morton J. Legeion "M J Legeion"
Reviews.Content: Not only did this tablet arrive a day before it was scheduled, it works much better than the price would indicate.  The overall speed, ease of use, memory utilization and general operation is outstanding. There are, of course, some down sides, but these are minor compared to the overall operation.  The quick start instructions fail to tell you that you have to push the power button twice, holding it the second time until it buzzes, to start the tab when the charger is plugged in, this is not true under battery operation. The WIFI tends to be intermittent but this improves with on time. Like all computers, it freezes at times, but defrosts itself with patience, one trick I found to speed this is to flip pages. The included apps, while pretty basic, work well. As is true of most touch screens, fingerprints seem to appear out of nowhere, but are easily removed with the provided dry cloth. The camera being only on the front side is great for video phone calls or video messaging, but not for taking pictures or video, although no worse than the cell phone I have that has the camera only on the outside making video calls a pain. Overall I'm impressed with this tablet and would recommend it to a first time tablet buyer or computer illiterate user. It definitely is going to be hard to beat for the money.
Reviews.Title: An Outstanding Value

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Right after I purchased the machine I wrote a glowing review. I loved it but my feelings have changed dramatically. I use it all the time, just the same. However. . .Look below for a current review after having owned this machine for the better part of a year. . .OKAY. I've had this tablet for 10 months or so. I hate it. Well, I actually have a love/hate relationship with it. When it works properly, I love it for all sorts of reasons. The design is nice with a solid brushed aluminum body. Impressive. There are many things I love about it but if it's not going to be reliable, it's useless. It freezes many times a day now. I do everything I can to maintain it but it just isn't agreeable. A few months ago, the pitifully designed power button broke. LePan fixed it and had great customer service, but it took over a month to get it back because they were so backed up. Hmmmm. . . .maybe this is a design flaw. I have tried to contact LePan about the freezing problem and they sent out a generic e-mail, rather than answered my problem. Sometimes it works very well and most times it freezes. Over and over again. I've limped it along for months but it's so bad I am thinking of buying a new tablet and giving this one to my kids. Currently looking at the Samsung Galaxy 2. $100 more, but it looks like it'll be worth it. You get what you pay for. . .But I'm still not gonna buy an i-anything. Samsung posers.
Reviews.Title: Frustrated  long time user!

Reviews.Author: Raoul Kamadjeu "Mak Luoar"
Reviews.Content: I shopped for a good HoneyComb tablet for a while. I play with most of them, Samsung, Motorola, Acer, you name it. The very high rating of the Le Pan I made me watch this closely. Two weeks ago, I finally decided to get it. It was a good move. I got this for $279 on Amazon. This thing rocks....! Why would someone pay $150 to $250 more for something probably equal or inferior? Have we been scammed by tablet manufacturers all this time?
Reviews.Title: Please save yourself several hundred bucks - get this...!

Reviews.Author: TedH
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this tablet that hasn't already been stated?  Purchased this for my wife.  Received on January 21st.  Charged it up, turned it on and it immediately recognized my network.  Typed in the access code and was off and running.  Brought the Le Pan II to my sons house and it immediately recognized his network, also.  It worked flawlessly on both networks.  My son was blown away by this unit and now wants one.  And, he is a long time Android user.  My wife brought it in to work.  One of her colleagues has already ordered one and another is seriously thinking of doing the same.Response time is as good as her Pentium dual core notebook.  Videos from Youtube, Netflix, Crackle, games, etc. all stream smoothly with no hesitation.  I have not experienced poor network connection, jerky or buffering video issues that a couple of posters have mentioned.  And, I'm pretty fussy.  Any issues I have experienced were application specific and had nothing to do with the Le Pan II.  There is a minute amount of bleeding in the corners from the LEDs used to backlight the screen.  But it is not noticeable when playing any video content.  I have the same effect on a 22 inch Samsung LCD TV.  This is truly not even worth mentioning.  But someone raised this point in a previous post.  Placed a video call using Tango.  Video and audio synced well.  The video coming from my sons end was not great, but he has a low res camera and he was in a dimly lit room at the time.  Will have to try again under better conditions.  As others have stated, this unit has a quality feel and the screen is incredible.  Nice touch sensitivity across the entire screen.  The fact that it has GPS capability without the need for 3G network connection is a nice bonus.  It's Wi-Fi and Bluetooth capable.  Battery life is great!!!  We are new to the Tablet and Android OS world.  The Le Pan II compares favorably to my wife's laptop, in many ways, and I can't imagine anyone not being thrilled with this unit.Purchased the Targus Truss case for the HP touchpad and everyone has been as impressed with the case as with the Le Pan II.  Have also purchased a class 10 32gb micro sd card and screen protector.
Reviews.Title: 5 Star Knockout !!!

Reviews.Author: Nick "Nick"
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before buying this tablet, I was looking for the larger screen under $200 and this was it . Right out of the box the screen was frozen, but I already knew that I needed to upgrade the firmware- there are great and easy instruction on the company's website and it took me all but 15min.- and I am not an expert in computers.The screen is crystal clear ( needs the screen protector! )and the colors are vibrant. It comes with the essential apps to get you started, and has access to the full android market and downloading apps could not be simpler weather you do it from the tablet or your PC.GPS works great and it is nice to see it on the big screen compared to my Tom Tom.Setting up and using email is easy. Using this is as easy as could be , my daughter uses an Ipad2 in school and she tells me this is less complicated and the touchscreen is more responsive, I don't have a comparison but I am very happy with it.One problem I have- I cannot install the amazon app store- but I think there has to be something I am doing wrong and I will search for a solution.I wish there was a case for it- I am a little confused as to which ones are compatible with the le pan since they all have different sizes listed, I am looking for a white or purple case under $10- so I have ordered a few to see which one fit best- I will update what I find out.Battery life is very good about 7hours on WIFI with a battery app.I think I will get the Le Pan 2 in a few months as a birthday present for my husband!eta:update- I did figure out how to install the amazon app store ( with help from amazon customer service ),which I love! The few apps I wanted to buy where cheaper here than on the android market, and amazon offers one free app a day. The Targus case did not fit at all despite a lot of ppl recommending it  , a regular Ipad case fits well but covers all the buttons and camera ( its the one I keept and cut it so the buttons are accessible because I liked the color and the tablet is more secure ) the" CrazyOnDigital Black Leather Case For Apple iPad" fits great and does not cover any buttons but it does not feel as secure.Edit 12/03/12Do not buy - customer service is NOT existent!! After 10 months the power button broke ( well known issue) and I can NOT reach customer service for repair. Their bbb raiting is F. As long as it works ..great but when you run into trouble dont expect any help from them!
Reviews.Title: Do not buy

Reviews.Author: tentonmosley
Reviews.Content: First of all.....Amazon is the best!  Shipping showed to be here in 5-8 days and it arrived in 2 days. Now to the Le Pan tablet.....I bought one for my daughter & this thing is incredible!  Super fast speed, very sensitive capacitive touchscreen, all the apps you want or need and it hasn't frozen even once after being on it most of the day.  I'm getting two Le Pan II's for me and my wife now and we are both excited about it.  My wife wanted an Ipad but after she saw what the Le Pan could do and not to mention the price, she changed her mind real quick!  Ok let me see, paying $760 for (3)THREE  9.7 inch tablets...(same size as Ipad), fast speed and bright, clear, colorful, sensitive touchscreen...(same as Ipad),  a ga-zillion apps....(same as Ipad),  only diffence is that you pay that price for ONE device if you buy the Ipad.  I have nothing against the Ipad however, its a great tablet but why pay more for the same features.  Buy the Le Pan or Le Pan II.....you wont be disappointed!
Reviews.Title: Absolutely Great tablet!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Bernice Dimiceli
Reviews.Content: My son got one of these from his grandma for Christmas and it seemed nice until 4 mo later it wouldn't charge or turn on. Le Pan has the worst warranty service EVER !!! You cant  get ahold of anyone to fix a problem they make u email back and  forth for months with NO WAY to contact other than emails they are slow and send you the most obvious advice like try tuning off and back on , try wiggling cord ect. ( Like we didn't try that duh )I just wanted to warn people to spend a few extra bucks and get a better brand with customer service not emails that don't ever help fix the problem He is asking for another tablet this year when I think the one he got should of lasted more that 4 months!!!!! Awful !!
Reviews.Title: Dont buy this brand!!!

Reviews.Author: fredsnothere
Reviews.Content: I received the Le Pan 2 as a gift and was very excited given the great reviews. You can imagine my disappointment when the tablet could not even connect to the internet. What can you do with a tablet without internet connection? not much.  It was all downhill from there.The customer support is a joke - its literally one guy who doesn't speak English well answering emails (they don't have phone support). They suggested i change some settings on my router - nothing worked although i did waste hours trying everything and even called my router tech support. Given the $300 price tag i bought a new router for $50 and luckily it was able to maintain a connection. but what if i want to visit a coffee shop, will the LePan be able to connect to that router? who knows...Basically this product is a piece of crap - another example - i couldn't download ebooks directly on my Google books app. It would open Google Play but there would be no option for searching e-books. i emailed Google Play tech support about this and they responded telling me the 'Le Pan' was not a supported device for Android (they've never even heard of it!) - i couldn't believe it.if you think you're saving money with this device - you're not. there's a reason everyone buys the iPad. you get what you pay for. Although in this case you get ripped off. its not worth the $300 price tag - i would say maybe $100.
Reviews.Title: terrible product,company and overall experience

Reviews.Author: G. Noonan
Reviews.Content: I got my wife one for christmas. It completly died after a couple of hours of use. Before it died I had fun with it installing apps but it froze up and needed to be reset no less than 3 or 4 times. Returned it for a refund. I'm tired of companies not having any burn in proccess or Quality Assurance.
Reviews.Title: Unstable/ plus you're the QA department

Reviews.Author: SamTheMan
Reviews.Content: If you want an IPAD, buy an IPAD.  However, if you want a great tablet without paying the insane prices for branded tablets,buy this one.  I am extremely satisfied with this purchase.  Screen is great, multi-touch is great.Takes a while to figure out all the bells and whistles, but I enjoy tinkering with devicesand discovering how things work.  It's not rocket science, so don't worry.  I have already downloaded a number of useful apps from the Android Market and fromthe Amazon Marketplace.  Plus, you can increase storage by adding a 32 gig micro SDHC card,which I did, since I saved some extra cash from this purchase alone.  So what if it's still 2.2 version? Still have plenty of useful apps available in the Android market for free.Like I said, if you have plenty of extra cash, spend it on the latest and greatest.  If you need something functional that will leave you with extra spending money for othertoys, buy this one.  In my case, I've saved enough to buy an MP4 player and a 32 gig micro SDHC card which I will load with tons of musicvideos and hook up the  player in my car.
Reviews.Title: Great Tablet

Reviews.Author: corinna
Reviews.Content: I had the Le pan given to me from my husband for Christmas and in the first hour it froze once. I cont'd to use it the following week thinking maybe it was a glitch....well, the whole thing is a glitch! It constantly froze anywhere from 1-4 times w/in just two hours of simply reading a book on it! I wasn't even trying to surf the web or asking it to do anything difficult for Gods' sake! Needless to say, I returned it and got our money back...what a waste of time and money!
Reviews.Title: Constantly freezes!

Reviews.Author: katatoie
Reviews.Content: I was thinking of getting an load or even the blackberry but this tablet is amazing. Great screen graphics look clear and crisp. I downloaded a keyboard for free that is much better than the ipads split keyboard.  Android marketplace is fantastic so many apps to choose from got angry birds for free even other apps that usually cost money but are free in the Android market. The gallery has a gorgeous layout quality isn't as good at viewing pictures that are saved off Facebook but still good for a tablet.Large screen is great for watching videos YouTube or others. Great for writing has everything the ipad has and more especially for the price great item.  Its my first tablet and I must say fantastic. I do my schooling with this tablet as well as writing notes and entertainment such as watching videos and playing games.  Reading is also fantastic with the Amazon kindle app. Anyways I give the tablet a 9/10 would be a ten if the graphics were better but for the price (when I bought was 207) fantastic would even pay 300.
Reviews.Title: great tablet

Reviews.Author: sarahhop2
Reviews.Content: We purchased a Le Pan tablet in December 2012. In July of 2013, the tablet would no longer charge so eventually wouldn't even turn on. At that time, I contacted Le Pan and they sent a brand new replacement tablet. Last week, the graphics on the replacement tablet became completely jumbled and discolored. I contacted Le Pan once again, went through all of their troubleshooting steps however nothing fixed it. I have been told today that only the original tablet was warrantied and because the warranty on the original tablet expired in December of 2013, they will not fix or replace our current tablet. These are terrible products.
Reviews.Title: Horrible Product

Reviews.Author: Darth Tesla
Reviews.Content: I can't get a support ticket or RMA from Lepan. Lepan has totally abandoned us. The website just a jumbled mess that cannot be navigated properly. They ignore their paying customers by waiting-out warranties. I loved this tablet at first, only to be disappointed by it's maker when it stopped working and taking a charge.
Reviews.Title: A VERY expensive brick or paperweight

Reviews.Author: thatguydowntheroad
Reviews.Content: This thing sucks! it electrocuted its self to death and smoked like crazy. I had to throw it in the snow and the manufacturer never got back to me. bad idea.
Reviews.Title: Save the money!! DO NOT BUY

Reviews.Author: John D. A.L. Oh.
Reviews.Content: Cannot get it to download anything off the internet. Called customer service was on the line for an hour then they came on and said they would call me back, that was 2 week's ago still haven't heard from them. It looks like a good deal at $200 but it's not worth $20 save your money.
Reviews.Title: No customer service

Reviews.Author: rwa929
Reviews.Content: I received the first LePan and the power/awaken button was defective.  I read online where this is the most common defect.  So I sent it back and it took 8 weeks to receive a new one...at my cost.  The replacement worked well for 2 weeks and then the screen cracked.  It still worked, but then cracked again in a totally isolated area from original crack 4 days after first episode.
Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed

Reviews.Author: T. Stephens
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to get this tablet based on the reviews. Had to exchange the first one they shipped because it wouldn't open photos. Got the second one and after a month I had to "reset" it because no apps would launch when clicked. After a week, the same thing. I'm over it. If you're gonna spend money on a tablet, put your money into a reputable name. Le Pan will never get my money again.
Reviews.Title: Horrible

Reviews.Author: roadmedic
Reviews.Content: We had this Tablet for aout 2 months before it started acting up. The manufacturer is not fixing the problem and I have been on hold with them for 45 min now with no answer. DO NOT BUY this!
Reviews.Title: does not work

Reviews.Author: Bettylou
Reviews.Content: I give this product a one star rating because -5 is not available. The tablet showed up from Amazon, and it seemed to do okay for about two months (30-days after the 30-day Amazon warranty expired). I took a chance on this tablet, know this device could be unstable, but I knew I wasn't going to use it very often. As it turns out, I did begin to depend upon it greatly, 6-months after my purchase, it just stopped working. I called Amazon and they referred me to the manufacturer.First things first, let's get the tablet review out of the way. As I said, it seemed to do okay the first 2-months, and then it became unstable. I understood that this operating system was not upgradable to Gingerbread, and I was okay with that.When I say it was unstable, I mean it lost internet connection frequently, forced closing apps, browser issues, etc. I understand that apps can be unstable on any device, but the most annoying was how it would lose internet connection from my Wi-Fi every time I used it. I would have to go through an 8-step series of steps to get back to where I was on the internet after losing connection. My daughter who also has an Android tablet (EVO view) did not suffer the same issues while using her tablet at the very same time. During the time I have owned this device, I have had to perform over five factory reboots.Let's say you were okay with the fact it is a low quality device, maybe you think "well, it's less than $200, you get what you pay for", you would be right! The only problem with this is that the customer service for LePan, which is who Amazon referred me to after explaining that there was a manufacturer alert for this product, is equally as unstable as the device they manufacture! I am still not sure why Amazon does not send out alerts on the products you purchase from them, after all, they send you everything else under the that have nothing to do and sometimes everything to do with products you purchase from them.Anyway, Amazon gave me the customer service number to contact LePan, and it took several phones to get through the first time. It was an automated voice recording (not a touch-system), and either it would re-loop the recording over and over again an insane number of times (in English, as well as Spanish), and the finally putting you out of misery by hanging up on you. You should know that during my time dealing with them for three weeks now, I have had repeated situations like this occur.At first, when getting a hold of a human, I explained what was transpiring and they referred me to their web site to fill out a claim form. The only problem with this is that my tablet no longer worked and I did not have access to the internet anymore! The representative explained that the device would have to be replaced, and that I would have to arrange and pay for the return of this device. Just so you are aware and you do not heed the advice in this post, it was over $26 to ship.The first night of making contact with them, my daughter came by with her laptop so I could set up a case to begin the process or the line of communication so I thought. It has been three weeks now, and I still do not have a replacement tablet. I found out through UPS (who are just as bad as LePan), that they had in fact delivered the defective tablet to LePan on the 10th, and still no tablet or sign of a tablet. I have written numerous times within their case system. So far, my inquiries have been met with either silence or silly questions like, "what is your shipping address", and in todays phone message "we have some more questions". You should know that when I filled out a case, I put in my shipping address, when I shipped the device back; it was tied to an RMA, which included my shipping address. When I shipped the device back, I included a manifest that contained my RMA, the Case # and my (drum roll please) .... Shipping Address!Your take away from this should be: Do not purchase this product because it is poorly manufactured and the vendor is irresponsible and unreliable.You should know that I do not have a negative view against everyone and everything. I am a little baised towards UPS and prefer Fed-Ex or USPS. I purchased from Amazon because of their liberal return policy. DO NOT COUNT ON THAT FOR THIS PRODUCT. I will still purchase from Amazon, but I will try to purchase the more expensive products in person, locally. I have recently purchased and IPad 2 that I am really loving now. The gentleman at the Apple store was knowledgeable and my experience there was a delight.I am exhausted, but I will keep you up to date. Thanks for reading and I hope this helps.
Reviews.Title: IMPORTANT

Reviews.Author: Love it
Reviews.Content: so i wanted to share my positive experience with this, so much that i bought one for my parents in law and my uncle, all of wich love it. mine has been comandeered by the wife and i plan on getting myself a separate one but really?????? who can beat this tablet for this price that can do so much. It doesnt freeze, the battery lasts forever, and i am a wireless manager, have access to any type of product i want including the Galaxy Tab 10.1 yet i trully appreciate the quality of this product. so it runs the older software. only one app i wanted didnt work. thats it! trust me on this, it is worth it to get one. there are even accessories now available on amazon specifically for it.
Reviews.Title: im up to three of these and love love love it

Reviews.Author: lucky
Reviews.Content: It is my 3rd tab. I like it better than brand. Good in this price. Buy it good deal.It is also look good. Sound is loud and clear.
Reviews.Title: Not big name but good work then big name's

Reviews.Author: JackRussell
Reviews.Content: ++++++ Update+++++++I have had the tablet for over a year now. Just before the one year was up I ended up sending it back to the manufacturer because it wouldn't boot up. LePan TOOK VERY GOOD CARE OF ME. They sent me a brand new one with in two weeks of receiving the one I was having issues with.. I have NOT had any issues with the replacement. I really liked how LePan backed up their product.I have had my tablet for a few months now. Its been great, I love it. It is quick and responsive. I have had no issues. I use a Logitech Ipad Bluetooth keyboard with it. This tablet has great features for the price.
Reviews.Title: Great Product for Great Price

Reviews.Author: geak
Reviews.Content: Can't some of the bad reviews. People need to do a little research. Would be nice this ran better right out of the box but.Try upgrading the firmware 9749.Install alittle widget called wifiwidget "fixes wifi issue not sure why"If your ambitious enough this tablet is now able to be rooted and there is a version cm7 gingerbread in its final stages of development .This is my second tablet but for a geek a gadget nerd this is great tablet dont believe there bs.
Reviews.Title: Awsome tablet!!!

Reviews.Author: Duncan Reever
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace a kindle gift which failed miserably in all respects.  It has proven exceptional as an e-reader for library e-books.  It came with an outlet charger so that even though the battery lasts about 8 hours, I can continue to read while seated in my comfortable reading chair.  It charges from an outlet near the chair.  It has google android 2.2, which means that I can not use it access audio books via overdrive service which requires version 2.4.  I do not believe I can upgrade the android version.  It has a sharp picture, adjustable spacing and type size and type.  It connects effortlessly to the wifi.  It has not frozen though I have had it operational on battery for 4-5 hours at a time.  It has other applications which I do not use as much as the reader as it is a tablet computer and not meant as an e-reader.  At a cost of $199 it provides considerably more than than similarly priced Amazon or Barnes and Nobel readers.  Its larger screen 9.7 inches creates the illusion of reading a paper book and it is comfortable to hold. For a technophobe such as myself it has provided a wonderful and painless access to my library system's e-books.
Reviews.Title: better than a kindle

Reviews.Author: T. Burrell
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and I have to say I made the right choice.  This is a wonderful product with very high quality.  I was worried that the price was too good to be true.  I was thinking, could a company really manufacture a very good tablet and sell it for a low price?  The answer is yes.  I've had absolutely no problems with the tablet and it has far exceeded my expectations.  The Le Pan 2 is a bargin and I highly recommend it.
Reviews.Title: Great Tablet for Great Price!

Reviews.Author: C. Brock "me"
Reviews.Content: Just got this bad boy in and it is working great. Played with it for only five minutes so I haven't had a chance to tell if it will freeze up often or at all. BTW....tablets do freeze up people it just comes with the territory. Couple of side notes, mine came with the updated firmware installed and I read that a couple of people were pissy because they couldn't read in the dark due to the soft keys not lighting up. Mine light up.I'll have more for you later but it is just as advertised.
Reviews.Title: Le Pan Tablet

Reviews.Author: G. Dancejic
Reviews.Content: This tablet is just as advertised. Solid for casual users - browsing, email, games, reading eBooks, Skype, music and video. We did not have any issue with Wi-Fi and speed, as reported by some. One star subtracted because of battery (it drains quicker than I expected, and it takes way too long to re-charge).  Camera is also not so good (using it with Skype), but I did not expect anything special.Other than that, Honeycomb is still not as robust operating system and some applications can crash from time to time, but that does not have anything to do with tablet itself.Overall, this is very good alternative for more expensive tablets. For those that are still researching, I can definitely recommend (and by the way, 7 inch tablets are just not big enough, even for casual users).Update (June 14th 2012):Many had problem with this tablet not powering up. I would like to share work-around for that issue, since I experienced it too.Likely cause: It looks that if you leave battery to drain completely, tablet will not be able to charge properly.Effect: As a result of above, tablet appears as dead, even if plugged in chargerWork-around: Use reset button (you will need to use something sharp to press it) to reset tablet while plugged in charger. If needed, unplug and plug charger again.Above works for me, and I can always recover from this issue. Of course, this is kind of annoying, but if you make sure to regularly charge tablet, and not letting it drain completely, it will work just fine. Bottom line is, this is design issue, but I guess it is expected for this kind of product.
Reviews.Title: Recommended for those looking for alternative to expensive tablets

Reviews.Author: D. Ho
Reviews.Content: I bought it with C. City thr. Amazon.  Le Pan II is great.  No wifi or youtube problem at all.  Battery is great.  Flash video is great.  I also have Ipad 2 which I miss flash video.  You can also play NES, SNES, GBA, N64....games on it.  It is very cool especially when you play N64 Mario 64.  I used Phillips Ipad 1 case and it fit.  I just need to make opening on top to use power button.  I installed volume in notification, so I can use the screen to adjust volume. Install EQ can help the volume much louder....I owned several Android tablet and this is the best buy....
Reviews.Title: Fun with good old time games

Reviews.Author: J. Crickenberger "cockatielmorse"
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and I'm very much a novice, but I did a lot of research and read a lot of reviews before buying the Le Pan II.  I was looking for something to supplement my new laptop, that was easy to carry and didn't break the bank.  I'm so glad I bought this tablet.  I've had it about a week now and it's so easy and great fun! I've had absolutely no issues with my wireless (Verizon) which I found to be very fast - surprisingly so. Overall, I think this tablet is very intuitive and comes with enough apps already installed that you can get started with it right away.  YouTube videos (at 1/3 of the screen size) buffer and play great. I downloaded some games for the heck of it and enjoyed them so much I was playing for hours.  I got over 6 hours on my 1st battery charge and that was downloading, playing movies and games and I even had a some windows open in the background.  It's very attractive in design and with a few add-ons (32 G card/case) I've got a very professional Internet browser, portable office, GPS (yep, a Garmin killer), game-playing machine. Remember, I don't root equipment, run technical programs, or tweak things to the nth degree, but I hate trying to do stuff on my LG phone, which is nice, but everything is so small........If I could change a few things (from a novice point of view), I would provide a more detailed users manual (available only from the Lepantab.com website) so I could better manage my installations and storage, etc.; do something about that funny pin connector; add a USB, and probably put the power button on the side instead of top right corner (awkward). No, this is not an Ipad - but Ipad's aren't $280 either.  Plus this tablet has an upgradeable OS.Yep, I love my LePan II tablet. I hope everyone buying one gets a good one like mine. It was a great way to enter the tablet market.... so worth it!!!
Reviews.Title: This tablet is SO WORTH IT!

Reviews.Author: Cornhuskers "Go Big Red!!"
Reviews.Content: This tablet is amazing do not let the brand name fool you. I have used a lot of tablets and this one by far is comparable to the brand name ones or if not more superior. This tablet is very responsive with every touch and lightning fast. I hear people talking about not being able to connect to wifi, I have not had any trouble in that department nor does my YouTube videos buffer. If you are having trouble with wifi change your security settings, just try different encryption example: wep, wpa etc.. I have herd that solved a lot of people's wifi issues. All in all I'm very happy with this purchase and glad I didn't judge this tablet by its name. I don't know why people what an ipad when it doesn't even play flash video's....how pathetic apple.
Reviews.Title: Amazing

Reviews.Author: christina
Reviews.Content: so i just recived my lepan 2 in the mial today. ive been playing around with it for the past few hours! i will hoestly say i was kinda iffy on getting the lepan 2 only because i had never heard of the product name before. so i spent about 2 1/2 weeks doing tons and tons of research on the lepan t970 when i stumbled accross the lepan 2. so i then started looking into that one already having liked the first one. i didnt really find as much about the second one. but read that the android market was upgradeable and that i wanted! i spent 295 dollars with shipping on my lepan 2 and let me just say....the price....is UNBEATABLE! i love the expandable storage (which they dont have on the ipad) the adobe flash player!(also not on the ipad) this is such an amazinggg product! while doing research i did notice alot of people saying  that the screen had a pretty bad glare and had very noticible fingerprints so being someone who like my things looking new anyway i purchased a anitglare and anti fingerprint screen! and it works amazinggg. i deff can say my money was well spent. Very High quality! not cheap like at all! and i was worried being such a low price that it may seem cheap....but its not! i love it! and im so glad that i decided to order andother one due to arrive tomorrow for my fiance! who is absolutlyyyy going to loveee it! no questions asked this product is GREATTTTTT! well worht the moneyy!!!
Reviews.Title: Excellentttttt Item!!!!!!

Reviews.Author: A. Krause "Andrew"
Reviews.Content: I got my Le Pan II less than 24 hours ago and I'm convinced that it's best buy I've ever made. It is decently powerful, and though it's a bit smaller than most of the 10.1" tablets out there, you don't miss the extra real estate. My only complaint is that the 32 pin connector is proprietary, so if I ever lose it I'm out of luck - unless I can modify an iPad connector to fit. Some notes:- The GPS is surprisingly accurate. I had this thing tethered to my HTC Incredible (rooted, installed Cyanogenmod 7 - highly recommend doing this), and when I fired it up while sitting in a parking space at my local Home Depot, the blue arrow was over the exact space I was sitting in. I tried it in a few other spots and it was within a couple of meters every time.- The honeycomb interface is slick. Most apps designed for handsets will scale nicely on honeycomb,and a few seem to know they're on a table and adjust their layout accordingly.- You might as well order the HP slate case that everyone else is getting.
