You won't find a decent quality case at your local big box stores that fits this unit. Get the screen protector too.- Update 3/5/2012 - Yes, you can use an iPad/iPod connector. On the tablets receptacle for the adapter, there is a small metal tab. You can carefully bend this back. it will only very slightly protrude above the openning, and won't interfere with the connector. You can get data and charge all on the same cord. Android coexisting with iOS technology?- Update 4/6/2012 - After using this tablet for a few months, I am still completely satisfied. It is equally adept at work or play. One quirk I discovered: You can't see certain apps in the android market. This is because while it comes with a Market (or "Play" as it's now called), the makers of the Tablet haven't registered with the open handset alliance. Therefore, they're blocked from downloading apps. The fix for this? You can "side load" apps - eg download them as an APK file, move them onto the tablet and install them that way. You won't be able to get updates from the market for side loaded apps. You'll need to root your tablet, then edit the build.prop file to change the fingerprint of the tablet to something else. This will only affect your market apps, and won't bother anything else. However, you may wind up loading incompatible apps, which can be inconvenient of they cause your tablet to malfunction.
Reviews.Title: Excellent Product

Reviews.Author: B. Eubanks
Reviews.Content: My husband has an iPhone for business, and my kids both have iPod Touches.  I am the "techie" in the family and saw how much enjoyment my kids were getting from their iPod Touches that I decided I wanted one myself - just to play around with.  Then reality sank in and I remembered how expensive they were and how I hated typing on them and viewing things on them with my 47 year old eyes.  I quickly vetoed that idea and then ran across this tablet one day.  It was something I thought was the best option for me.While it is not as slick as the Apple products, it is slick enough for me.  I have been able to make use of free apps that I use on a daily basis that help me be more productive both at home and work (I work from home).  I use dropbox, goodle docs, open office viewer, documents to go, springpad, evernote, skitch, mint, youtube, facebook, pandora, sugarsync,flixster, astrid tasks, remind me, assistant, kitchen timer, stopwatch, voice recorder, alarm clock plus, the weather channel, habit streak, gmail, mobo task killer, chore checklist, angry birds, jewels, word search, words with friends, lose it, workout trainer, food planner, adobe reader ,etc.  I am finding I am using this tablet more for productivity reasons (work & reminders) that it probably has already paid for itself in the many little ways it has helped me out.Using the Mobo Task Killer frequently after opening a lot of apps, helps me keep freezing issues at bay for the most part.I wake up with alarm clock plus which lets me customize how I want to be awaken.  I prefer a gentler way of waking up as opposed to standard alarm clocks that wake you up by scaring you to death with their loud buzzing.  Upon waking, I can quickly check the weather with the weather channel app so everyone in the family immediately knows how to dress.  No more turning on the tv and waiting for the weather report to come up.  Time for work, it is a great complement to my pc because I can reference pdf documents on the tablet as I do my work on the PC (thanks to dropbox and adobe reader), and I can check email quickly and easily as well.  Dinner time, I can reference a recipe on the tablet as it stands it the Targus case I got for it (for the HP Touch-fits well), and cook up something new for the family.  After dinner, relax and do some light surfing, reading, video watching, or game playing all while sitting comfortably on the couch.  I've even used the navigation app once just to see how it worked and it works just fine in one direction anyways.  I still print out instructions from my pc, but it's nice to hear a play by play as well.So I got this tablet thinking I would probably never use it all that much, but now that I have it I am using it every single day and for so many reasons.  For my needs this tablet is all I will need for quite some time even if it is Android 2.2 and not the latest and greatest. I can live without it being as slick as an Apple because it is affordable, productive and fun and pretty slick in it's own way.
Reviews.Title: Productive and Fun

Reviews.Author: AznSensation21
Reviews.Content: I got the Le Pan TC970 about 4-5 weeks ago and it has been running like new ever since. Despite only being Android 2.2 and having a successor (the Le Pan II) with Android 3.2, this is a great tablet especially for the price. It has exceeded my expectation 100%. It is sort of a 2010 tablet, considering the 1GHZ processor, the older system OS and what not, but in all honesty, if your a person like me who just needs a tablet to cure boredom at work or even just to sit on your lazy butt on the couch and not have to worry about a laptop or walking to your desktop, then definitely get this tablet. My only gripe about this tablet, is sometimes you need to reset the tablet because of some software hiccups, like a system freeze and being directed back to the main screen (meaning the load screen when first turning on the device), but it only happens once in a while, plus it's only happened to me twice. Other than that, I do highly recommend it, I even got one for my mother as a christmas gift. But if Android 2.2 and a single core 1GHZ processor isn't your thing, then a I recommend trying out the Le Pan II, considering the price point and Android Honeycomb and it's ability to be upgraded to Android 4.0 ICS. I have ordered a case for it (a Targus Truss case for the iPad 1) and I will update this review when I get it, also I will be doing a 6 month update as well.
Reviews.Title: Solid tablet for the price

Reviews.Author: drewsully
Reviews.Content: I have spent weeks looking for the best tablet/e-reader and I feel I made the best choice. yes of course this isn't an ipad but for 200 bucks it is amazing. Because it is to top of the line there are things that cheap people wanting an expensive tablet but not willing to pay for will complain about. I bought two of these one for me for work and play and one for my wife for reading and a recipe book and play. I don't see the need to upgrade to a higher android since this one does what we want it to and more. All we did is install the go launcher app (which allows you to rotate the screen in all directions in all screens) and we could customize it enough for us. We both have our smart phones root so we have our own dedicated hotspot for them. Screen is way clear but I think the recommended screen protector is a must because of finger prints. It feels like the original ipad is a very slick device. I might sound cheesy but I love the tassel that comes with it, it makes me feel more comfortable when I am holding it. Charging is fast and the battery is great. My first charge I installed everything I wanted and watched a full Netflix movie on it before it even hit 20%. I will say that my only issue is the Wi-Fi and it is because if it's on and you don't use it for a bit you have to turn it off and then back on when is not that big of a deal if you download a Wi-Fi toggle off the market place also the volume buttons feel like they are backwards but other than those this is a smooth device especially for the price, all my friends want one now.
Reviews.Title: even better than i expected

Reviews.Author: Brenda Leatherman "dragongodbml"
Reviews.Content: I have had this for 2 night thus far. Being new to Android field, it is alot of fun have set this up for all my emails and games. Started to read a book on it. I fully charged it the first night and Wi-Fi set up was a minute total. Up and running and super fast web browsing. I am have problems loading you tube but I will work on that later on. More on this review as I learn more about this.
Reviews.Title: WOW....impressed..........

Reviews.Author: mjrjolt
Reviews.Content: This tablet ROCKS!! I've had my LePan since Christmas and it hasn't disappointed me. It's everything I was looking for in a tablet. I can watch YouTube videos, or a movie on Netflix with no problem. The videos are high-def. quality and the sound is above-average, better than what I have on my Toshiba laptop.I've downloaded a ton of apps and they install seamlessly.I've installed two updates and they were fairly easy, just follow the instructions.This tablet is somewhat heavy, but it is well-made and they've packed a lot into it. If you're looking for a full-featured, high-quality tablet that will function like an iPad or Samsung Galaxy, then this is the one for you. I'm sure down the road, I'll purchase the newer version, LePan2, but for now, I don't feel like I'm missing anything as far as speed or features.
Reviews.Title: Great tablet for the price!!

Reviews.Author: Joan Morgan
Reviews.Content: I take it everywhere I go.  Everything from settings to checking email was so easy to set up and go on with what you got this fun and useful tool for.  The only thing I didn't like was the way its set up to take pictures.  Its backwards to me., but, love the fact you can use the sd card that comes with it.  For the money, this is one heck of a buy!!
Reviews.Title: Have fun with this one!

Reviews.Author: Steff
Reviews.Content: The LePan is a great tablet with a full android market. There are tons of other tablets out there that claim to have the android market but have another knock off that is very limited. I have used amazon market, itunes, and by far this Android market has many more free apps.It is the same mkt as my android smart phone which makes sharing and organizing info very easy. I highly recommend this tablet to anyone wanting an affordable and functionable tablet for a great price. Yes it is made in China, but so is the Ipad. If you want an american made tablet expect to pay double or triple the cost. This tablet can also be used as a phone with video chat and text messaging thru wifi. Its endless what you can do with the assortment of Apps.
Reviews.Title: Great product, better than Ipad

Reviews.Author: Mark M Vick
Reviews.Content: I just received my Le Pan II tablet today (Feb 1) and instantly started having problems with the Wi-fi.The tablet is able to see access points but never able to connect.After talking with Le Pan customer service about the issue I learned that is a common problem and was told I should just return it to amazon and wait (another month) for a replacement.After waiting over a month for this one only to have problems and a very unsympathetic customer service employe saying this happens a lot means I will not get a replacement but a refund.The tablet itself looks and feels great but with the common wi-fi problems and the horrible customer support I would pass if I go back and do it again.
Reviews.Title: Good tablet.... if it worked right.

Reviews.Author: cyberRocker
Reviews.Content: *** ALSO SEE UPDATES BELOW ***I've had this for a couple of weeks now and it's a great tablet. Some reviewers on here have complained about wifi speed issues, but I've had no problems at all (there may be some lemons out there). You'll want a case for it since it's not easy to hold. It's very well made with a brushed aluminum back...but it can slip out of your hands very easily.The touchscreen is very responsive, no slight delays like I've seen on youtube reviews of the older TC970 (this is the TC979 aka Le Pan II). For smooth app install/purchase, make sure you have a google account.I was listening to music with the installed Pandora software last night through headphones and it sounded wonderful! Some have complained about the external speakers, but what do you expect with a small device like this? Most people use headphones or mp3 players for music anyway. You can easily plug in bigger external speakers like people do with mp3 players via the headphone jack or even bluetooth.Pros: Bright screen, excellent resolution, 4:3 aspect ratio (perfect for web surfing), micro SD card slot for expanded storage up to 32GB (buy one with a a full-size SD adapter or a USB plug that reads micro SD for file transfers) Kingston Flash Card Reader MobileLite G2 USB 2.0 Multi-card Reader FCR-MLG2, not too heavy, Android 3.2 upgradable to 4.0, bluetooth. Plays videos smoothly. Half the price of an ipad.Cons: No USB slot or jack to read thumbdrives, 30-pin connector with no dongles that Le Pan advertises that'll will work for devices such as USB, HDMI & so on (maybe that will change with firmware? Le Pan???) minus 1 star. Fingerprint magnet, a little slippery to hold without a case. Sound not very loud in speakers (there are EQ apps for that though). I have a dead pixel that creates a faint line across the top of the screen. Hoping that won't bother me any worse. A slight bit of light bleeding in the corners on black screens...not very noticeable...but at least it didn't cost $600+!I highly recommend this tablet. If only they would start stocking it again!***UPDATE 1/27/12***I've decided the dead pixel creating the faint line across the screen bothered me enough to do an RMA exchange with where I bought it. So, I'll be tabletless for a while...hope I can handle it :PAlso hoping the new tablet won't have any wi-fi issues like some here are having.***UPDATE 3/01/12***Got the replacement tablet a few weeks ago.Works perfect so far (no dead pixels, wifi works great). I still highly recommend this tablet. But if you get one in with any problems...send it back for a replacement because if you get one that works fine, you'll be very pleased with it.
Reviews.Title: Very happy...with just a few quirks.

Reviews.Author: H Becerra
Reviews.Content: I had originally bought this tablet from the Walmart website because it was out of stock on Amazon. It was a birthday present for my husband. I had done a lot of research on tablets before I purchased and the Le Pan seemed like the best performer for the price (I couldn't afford to buy any of the higher range tablets).The tablet that arrived from Walmart was a complete disaster. It was missing the SD card, there was no manual/instructions included and the tablet had obviously been previously handled because it was covered in fingerprints. It performed horribly - constantly needing to be reset. I was very disappointed and returned the tablet to Walmart with the intention of purchasing a different tablet. My husband however had since read Le Pan reviews and was confident that if we tried another one from somewhere else it might be different.So I bought a Le Pan from Amazon and it was like a completely different product. Everything that should be included was there and there have been absolutely no problems with it a month later.My husband is a techie nerd and he loves the Le Pan. Every evening after dinner he settles down on the couch with his tablet and is like a kid with a favourite toy!I have a feeling the tablet I purchased from Walmart was a refurbished model, or perhaps a returned faulty one.
Reviews.Title: Excellent tablet for the price

Reviews.Author: Joseph Duncan "JWD"
Reviews.Content: I love gadgets, so I decided to give the Le Pan TC 970 a shot. For a bargain basement tablet, it is so close to awesome that it kind of makes its failings more obvious. On the plus side, you have a gorgeous 9.7 inch screen, very snappy multi-touch controls and a solidly built casing. On the negative side, it is running Android 2.2 and takes quite a bit of fiddling to get a good collection of apps. Seems like half the stuff I download thought I was using a phone and wouldn't display full screen or was in low resolution mode. Battery for me drains pretty quick. I don't know why because everyone else seems to think this thing has an awesome battery. I have to say, however, that I am satisfied with this purchase so far. I have netflix for movies, pandora for music, comicat to read my comic books, dolphin hd browser for surfing, and kindle for reading. All work great and in high resolution. For news I have Huffington Post, Techcrunch, Pulse, and CNET. They work great, too. Youtube works. The only thing I found lacking was the games. Bejeweled 2, Angry Birds, Cardshark, Peggle, Where's My Water and Cut the Rope worked fine. Other games like Scrabble, Fruit Ninja etc would crash, display half-screen in cell phone mode or in low resolution. Unfortunate, because the screen is so nice and touch is so responsive. For what I need it to do, read books, magazines and comics and maybe listen to some music and watch a video every now and then, I give it four stars. I deduct one star for the limited game capabilities. This thing is almost a good budget Ipad if only more games would work correctly on the thing.
Reviews.Title: Almost Awesome

Reviews.Author: Brian Harris "Flash N Le Pan II"
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone, this is my first post here but i hope it helps someone. Below is a link someone posted on Amazon for a great case that fits the Le Pan tablets. It's for the CaseCrown Hard Case (Black) for the Apple iPad 2 Wifi / 3G Model 16GB, 32GB, 64GB.It got lots of great reviews from the iPad users so I ordered it last week for the Le Pan II I had on order from Amazon but they couldn't deliver my Le Pan before Jan. 31st to Feb. 9th so i canceled there and ordered it from Best Buy... it arrived today and it looks fantastic  I haven't tried it yet because I read the manual for the 970 and it says FULLY charge the battery for at-least 8hrs. before the first use and after thet you can use the tablet while charging but only after the first charge so i called Le Pan support and they say yes its the same rules for the Le Pan II then he e-mailed me the user manual for the Le Pan II because some units shipped before the manual was ready. But the case arrived yesterday and this case is a perfect fit for the Le Pan it doesn't block any ports or controls, you can even connect the charger with it in the case It's a hard case with soft padding inside. What the pictures on amazon do not show is that if you rotate it so that the case top is on your lap you can then adjust it for better typing angles. I saw a YouTube video of a guy testing this case by throwing his iPad on a rock. I don't recommend doing that but it is a very good case that offers great protection for your tablet, much better than those silicone sleeves I see everywhere. The only thing I see wrong is I might need to cut 2 small speaker holes in the inner pad that holds the tablet... but I'll wait to see how it sounds in the case first.I got mine for $3.21 but it looks like when they started getting lots of orders from Le Pan owners they raised their price to $15.21But even at the higher price I still think it's better protection then those folios because it zips closed all the way around. It's very slim and adds almost NO weight to your tablet.I hope this wasn't too long and it helps save someones tablethttp://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004QJ3ML0/ref=s9_simh_gw_p147_d0_g147_i1?pf_rd_m=ATVPDKIKX0DER&pf;_rd_s=center-4&pf;_rd_r=1NBNP76G51P8V00886NB&pf;_rd_t=101&pf;_rd_p=470939031&pf;_rd_i=507846
Reviews.Title: Need a great case/stand for your Le Pan? Here it is!!!

Reviews.Author: Darelian
Reviews.Content: I stumbled on this tablet by accident. We were looking for a tablet for my 87 year old mother.. Basic needs were, large easy to see screen, ability to do email, web surfing, and skype.  Did not want to spend $500 on an iPad II ... Good product but just too expensive for this situation.  Originally had what we thought was a great deal on demo model Motorola Zoom at a local retailer but when the time came, the price was higher than we agreed, etc, etc...So we walked and then had to find a solution quickly... 72 hours to be precise!  Started searching online... what did we do before Amazon, eBay, etc.?..Found the Le Pan TC970 ... Met our criteria with a good sized screen.  Limited to Android 2.2 Froyo but I'm reasonably confident my Mother wouldn't know Froyo from Frodo so no worries there... Older simpler interface is actually a good thing in this situation.  Got it online with rush delivery for around $225 and was really impressed.  Is it bleeding edge tech? .. No.  Does it do everything the low to mid range tech level user wants?...YES!  Nice screen and touch sensitivity is good.  Sound is O.K. ... I have a HP Touchpad which has the "Beats" sound system and is IMHO the best sound but wait .. It's a tablet not a boom box!  Plug in some ear buds and it sounds as good as a $500+ tablet.  Connected to WiFI out of the box with no issues.  E-mail setup easy.  Latest version of Skype works .. Minor glitch with video on the Le Pan end only for the first 5 seconds, then works great.  Browser is great.  All other functions work as described.  Power connector is a Apple iPad connector and plugs into any USB power source.  All the apps I downloaded from the marketplace worked great.  My 87 year old mother has mastered receiving and sending e-mail, browsing so she can find an listen to Andrea Bocelli singing, and even got Skype vodeo chat working though she keep covering the camera with her thumb :-)For the price, this is a great product.  I don't understand why this product and manufacturer doesn't get more media coverage .. IMHO this is the iPad rival .. Only slightly heavier than my wife's iPad II, great fit and finish with nice sturdy feel (not plastic), does almost as much (and plays flash!), and is half the price!I beleive the new Le Pan II is now out and there are some other models in the pipe from this manufacturer... Should be be considered by anyone buying a tablet.
Reviews.Title: Best kept secret

Reviews.Author: pbowen2112
Reviews.Content: For anyone checking these reviews.  I emailed Le Pan support asking for a release date. (Yes, as previously stated, this product has NEVER been released.)  They responded promptly with 'sometime in January'.
Reviews.Title: Release Date

Reviews.Author: fishin dude
Reviews.Content: If you are on the fence about getting this tablet, jump off and get it.Picture looks great, screen is responsive and mutli touch works great.Dual core works well and has handled everything I've thrown at it.Kids watch Netflix on it all the time, videos either copied from my media server (converted for the screen size via CloneDVD mobile) or from wifi work great.Apps work great, have only had one or two from the Playstore/Market that didn't work, the others worked fine.Speakers sound pretty good for their size, no subs or huge bass, but audible and not hard to hear at all.Charges a little slow in my opinion, but the battery last quite awhile, I'd say 6-8 hours depending on wifi, brightness, etc...I picked up the HDMI cord for this and it works great, but you do have to change a couple things in settings to activate it (at least with Honeycomb). Just go to settings, then Screen, then HDMI OUTPUT, and your good to go. Picture looks great on my tv, 4:3 format though, but most TV's will allow you to stretch it out.GPS works pretty good, but I haven't tested it outside of my back/front yard.Front camera works, but is a little hazy, but its 1.2 mp, so it is what it is.Put a 32 gb card in this and I've got a full season of Spongebob (12 episodes), full season of Scooby Doo(12 episodes), 8 NickJr epidsodes and 6 full movies and still have over 17gb left. And if you need more room, load another 32gb card (or 2) and you can have a huge movie catalog to go without having to use wifi. Oh yeah, and you still have 8gb built in... Suck it Apple!I picked up a screen protector and a generic ipad case for it, so everything is protected on when you use or transport it.I have not upgraded to ICS yet, and since I really don't have any issues right now, I don't think I will for awhile. Maybe to try it out later, but will let other folks work out the kinks first (if there are any).
Reviews.Title: HDMI cord works great

Reviews.Author: KISS fan
Reviews.Content: I've only had this tablet for 5 days now, but boy is it nice! I was considering the iPad, but the price was out of reach for me. I happened to stumble accross this one here on Amazon. I read the reviews, watched many videos on YouTube and decided to take the plunge and order it. I thought why not give it a try? Amazon has great return policies. I considered the fact that it was a tablet, and a brand name I had never heard of, so I bought the extended warranty for it as well. I am a Tech, so I figured I could fix it if it broke, but the $60 price of the warranty was a no brainer.  I am very pleased with the overall quality of it so far. It's fast, the screen is great, and it's internal memory is expandible up to 32gb. The build quality is solid and I like the aluminum back. The only thing I found was a little flimsy was the power cord end where it plugs in to the Le Pan. It felt like the plastic end was a little thin and hollow feeling. It picks up my wi-fi signal very well. There is no lag when watching You Tube or Netflix.The only real downfall I see as of right now is the lack of accessories. Maybe that will change as this gains market share, but don't expect to go to your local retailer and pick up a case or extra charger and cable. I did buy a case for it here on Amazon that was custom made for the Le Pan 1 and 2 and it fits great!It's hard to find a used iPad at this price, and this tablet is every bit as good as an iPad 2 at more than half the cost. Go ahead and order it. You can return it if you don't like it, but I bet you end up being very happy with it.UPDATED: I had it for 9 days and loved it, but it wouldn't turn on today. Had it plugged in to the charger all night. No Le Pan logo, nothing...It was a really nice tablet for the 9 days it worked. I thought I would get something comparable to Apple, and it was,but It should last for more than 9 days.I'm going to buy an iPad.
Reviews.Title: This is a great tablet, FOR THE 9 DAYS IT WORKED!

Reviews.Author: Liz M J
Reviews.Content: First let me say I am an Amazon customer, but did not purchase the LE PAN TC 970 from Amazon, however to be fair, i have had it for over a month, it froze a few times, as you will notice from most of the reviewers, but with the reset, it would then work ok.  It would automatically kick itself off my WIFI, but when it worked it was very fast in downloading apps, and web pages.  My son loves Thomas the train, and there is only one Android Thomas app, (no fault of Le Pan) but when you go to the official Thomas website the puzzle game is not optimized for play, so my son gets frustrated with it, and i know it is the android market, because he is able to play those same puzzles on my computer with no problem.  To get to the meat of the matter, you cannot delete an app from the home screen, even after moving it to one of the extended screens, it still sits on the home screen. Well, I hate this thing now, because it stopped working completely this morning! no amount of trying to reset it will make it turn on, so imagine my explaining to my 3 year old, that his tablet is broken, and he will have to go back to his VTECH reader, he took it in good strides, luckily because is dad and I, always tell him these are just "things" they can be gone in a second!Please double think before you purchase, if you want cheap go for this, just be prepared it may be broken and gone after one month!, he never dropped it, and i was right there with him this morning playing his ROARY game when it just went blank.  Of course my 30 days return is up so I cannot return it, and Le Pan's customer service will not be available before Monday.  If you need a tablet for yourself or child, just make a good choice, and proper investment, we paid $250 for it, and still thought it was reasonable, but I guess reasonable is not good enough!!  Will update again, when I call their customer service
Reviews.Title: YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR!1

Reviews.Author: Lynne Pala
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter for Christmas and it only worked for about 20 mins. We tried everything, letting it charge overnight, emailing the Le Pan company about 5 times and finally they asked us to send it back to them after faxing them some info and then emailing them again once the fax was sent. We also had to pay the shipping cost to get it back to Le Pan! Supposedly, they're going to send us another one that actually works. We shall see. I'll keep you posted.

Reviews.Content: I got le pam earlier today and i cant believe how fast and well built it is. The screen is amazing and everthing works great. They need to sell this for about 350 and it works just as good as android tablets in the stores and the ipad..great tablet.
Reviews.Title: extremely good tablet

Reviews.Author: John Collins
Reviews.Content: To all who are thinking of buying this product because of the great price DON'T until you read what I have to say about this tablet. I purchased the Le Pan TC970 for my wife as a Valentines gift. I only read the great reviews of the product and not the 3, 2, or 1 star reviews. I will not make that mistake again.  I made the purchase on Feb. 8th 2012. Right out of the box it had charging problems but after left charging for over 24 hours it worked fine as long as it was always charged. If the battery ran 3/4 of the way down the tablet would just shut off and not turn back on till it was fully charged the next day. I should of sent it back right then and there but I chose to ignore it because it would work fine again. My wife enjoyed using the tablet for the Kindel  books and Pinterest. No games were ever played on it. It was well taken care of. Well fast forward to 6/25/2012 6:44 PM. My wife hands me the tablet and says it is falling apart. I look at it and the screen is popping up and on the bottom edge the seam is coming apart. I first attempted to call the warranty hotline and was told that all operators were busy and to file a claim online. Well I did that at the e-mail that was provided on their warranty page. I sent a picture in with the email and was referred to open a ticket through the website. I did that and was given a response that the sent my case was being sent to their corporate office. Here is all that transpired. This was copied and pasted from their support page. I did not edit it. I even left my spelling errors.Case History (10 Comments)John L. Collins on 6/29/2012 8:48 PMI doubt you truly care. It is sad that based on 1 picture you decided that I destroyed my tablet. That I had to be the one to do it. You didn't even try to help. The only thing you did try was to get me to spend another $150 on the same piece of junk. I would of probably spent the money if you would of at least looked at what would cause it to come apart. If I would of never sent the picture of the tablet then it would be in the mail today with no problems. Instead I tried to do the right thing and trust in your company's warrenty. I would of prefered to have spoken to a operater and discussed this. I made repeated attemps to call with only answering machine to telling to file though here. I should of listened to the reviews of other dissatisfied customers but instead I was being cheap. Lesson learned. I promise that my review of your product will be posted on every place that will let me. I am copying and pasting everything that was emailed back and forth. My review may not stop everyone from buying your products but it will stop some. I am looking into my states lemon laws. I may or may not find anything to help my case but if I do find something you can bet that I will post it everywhere your product is sold. You have a good day.LePan Support on 6/29/2012 9:58 AMJohn,Again, our sincerest apologies that you are so unsatisfied. We have appealed to our superiors again, and they are adamant that we cannot proceed with a normal warranty replacement.John L. Collins on 6/28/2012 4:09 PMOkay the damage to my tablet is due to faulty equipment. It has never been misused. So how is it not covered by the warrenty? I would like to talk to someone in person so one of your operators can explain to me why you will not honor your warrenty. This is stated on your website.1. WHAT DOES THIS WARRANTY COVER?This warranty covers any defects or malfunctions in your new Le Pan tablet PC or accessories. 2. HOW LONG IS THE PERIOD OF COVERAGE?This warranty is valid for service as follows: one (1) year no charge for parts and labor from the date of purchase.3. WHAT WILL LE PAN DO?LABOR: If the product is determined to be defective within one (1) year of the date of purchase, Le Pan will repair or replace it at no charge. After the one (1) year has expired, you will be responsible for any labor charges.PARTS:If service is being performed by a Le Pan technician, the cost of parts is covered for up to one (1) year from the date of purchase. Le Pan will not repair or replace defective parts unless the work is performed by a La Pan technician. Proof of purchase in the form of a bill of sale, receipt or an invoice must be provided at the time the service is requested in order to receive warranty service.our website.I am not trying to scam, lie or cheat you. All I want is for you to help fix this problem under your warrenty. I can take close up pictures of every inch it. I do not know why the center of it started to come apart. If I or anyone in my house hold broke it by accident or on purpose I would not even try to have this fixed. I am asking for help with your product.LePan Support on 6/28/2012 3:38 PMHello Customer,Unfortunately the kind of damage to your tablet is not covered under our one year limited warranty.This damage that has occurred to the tablet can be fixed for the fee of $150 USD, plus the shipping costs. If you would like to pay this fee to have your tablet replaced we can process an RMA for you. Please let me know how you would like to proceed from here and if you have any questions.Thank you John L. Collins on 6/28/2012 2:09 PMOkay in the picture you have please indicate where you see pry marks. In the thousands of cases you handled if someone prys apart the case made of plastice there would be pry marks. The only place on the case that is coming apart is shown in the picture. As I have indicated before there is no damage done to the case. The screen came popped up because of.the buldge at the bottom of the tablet. I am smart enough not to pry open a 4 month old tablet. Heck even my 5 year is smart enough not to do that. please tell me of any other way I could have done this and not show ANY damage.LePan Support on 6/28/2012 1:08 PMJohn,Our apologies that you feel this is unjust. Having issued thousands of units, fielded thousands of support cases, and replaced a number of damaged units, none of the previous cases have ever fallen apart as your tablet has. This decision was not made lightly, and we consulted the highest of possible authorities within the company. Their determination was that your tablet appears to have been mishandled, and someone likely attempted to pry the unit open. We can reach no other conclusion based on the picture that you have sent. Once again, our apologies that this is not covered. We can offer you a replacement for a fee of $150. We do appreciate your business, and apologize for not being able to offer anything further. John L. Collins on 6/28/2012 12:58 PMPlease tell me your definition of accidental damage. My definition is that some type of accident has to occur. The tablet has not been mishandled, dropped, thrown, kicked, or any other kind of action that would damage it. There are no scratches, scrapes, chips, or any other damage marks on yje tablet. No games are played on it. It is kept next to my bed where only my wife uses for reading and Facebook. I will not spend $150.00 to repair this when it should be covered by your warrenty. If you will not stand by your workmanship then the only accident on my part is trusting your products and your company. Please decide if you want to keep me as a valued customer and honor you warranty or that you are happy with taking my money this time and the review I will write on Amazon about this product amd your company.LePan Support on 6/28/2012 10:30 AMHello Customer,unfortunately the kind of damage that you've described is not covered under our one year limited warranty, which does not extend to accidental damage. We offer only a manufacture warranty good for 1 year from the date of purchase (this cannot be extended or enhanced in any way).This damage that has occurred to the tablet can be fixed for the fee of $150 USD, plus the shipping costs. If you would like to pay this fee to have your tablet replaced we can process an RMA for you. Please let me know how you would like to proceed from here and if you have any questions.Thank youLePan Support on 6/27/2012 4:18 PMJohn,Because we are unable to determine whether or not this is manufacturing error or user error, we are forwarding your case to the corporate office. They will let us know how to proceed. Our apologies for the delay. John L. Collins on 6/25/2012 6:44 PMHello. Myname is John Collins. I bought the LePan tc970 back on February 8, 2012. Everything was fine (except that it charged very slow) until it started falling apart. There is a bulge at the bottom seam and it will not close back. That caused the screen to start coming up on the bottom left. Now it won't even turn on.Please help with this problem.  _______________________________________________________________________________Please everyone be very careful when buying this tablet or any other  Le Pan product because you will be going through the same problem  I just went  through.  Please read all the reviews on Amazon or were ever  you can find one.  I pray that you don't end up with a 200 dollar paperweight like I just did.
Reviews.Title: Consumers beware!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Brian Harris "Flash N Le Pan II"
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone, this is my first post here but i hope it helps someone. Below is a link someone posted on Amazon for a great case that fits the Le Pan tablets. It's for the CaseCrown Hard Case (Black) for the Apple iPad 2 Wifi / 3G Model 16GB, 32GB, 64GB.It got lots of great reviews from the iPad users so I ordered it last week for the Le Pan II I had on order from Amazon but they couldn't deliver my Le Pan before Jan. 31st to Feb. 9th so i canceled there and ordered it from Best Buy... it arrived today and it looks fantastic  I haven't tried it yet because I read the manual for the 970 and it says FULLY charge the battery for at-least 8hrs. before the first use and after thet you can use the tablet while charging but only after the first charge so i called Le Pan support and they say yes its the same rules for the Le Pan II then he e-mailed me the user manual for the Le Pan II because some units shipped before the manual was ready. But the case arrived yesterday and this case is a perfect fit for the Le Pan it doesn't block any ports or controls, you can even connect the charger with it in the case It's a hard case with soft padding inside. What the pictures on amazon do not show is that if you rotate it so that the case top is on your lap you can then adjust it for better typing angles. I saw a YouTube video of a guy testing this case by throwing his iPad on a rock. I don't recommend doing that but it is a very good case that offers great protection for your tablet, much better than those silicone sleeves I see everywhere. The only thing I see wrong is I might need to cut 2 small speaker holes in the inner pad that holds the tablet... but I'll wait to see how it sounds in the case first.I got mine for $3.21 but it looks like when they started getting lots of orders from Le Pan owners they raised their price to $15.21But even at the higher price I still think it's better protection then those folios because it zips closed all the way around. It's very slim and adds almost NO weight to your tablet.I hope this wasn't too long and it helps save someones tablet[...]here is the video of guy testing this case...[...]
Reviews.Title: Need a great case/stand for your Le Pan? Here it is!!!

Reviews.Author: J. Lin "BB king"
Reviews.Content: I've got one of these, and I love everything about it specially the screen. That's the part of the tablet I spend the most time with. The viewing angle is amazing. Unlike, my previous other tablets. I kid you not, if you are looking at one part of the screen closely, you're likely going to have to move the tablet in order to see other parts clearly. I can't see what's on the screen when it's sitting flat on my desk, under my chin, directly in front of me. It's really REALLY bad. I am very glad this tablet solve that issue, now it so pleasant to read and watch movie with out worry to fixed in ther right position.  I highly recommend this tablet to other with viewing angle issue.
Reviews.Title: Viewing Angle

Reviews.Author: Jennifer M. Polk
Reviews.Content: I Purchased this Tablet for my mother for a Christmas present. She never owed a computer so i figured this would be great for her to have to use Facebook with etc ...My Boyfriend and Myself set up the tablet on Christmas and it worked fine. But on the second day of using after trying to set up wireless connection ( which was fine ) The screen staled on me while using it. Im use to that because I have an Android phone, so I shut it down and restarted it. it happened a few more times I kept quickly fixing it and moved on.what really upset  me was on the 3rd day, i was at work and my mother wanted to surprise me by writing something on Facebook. And she couldn't get it open . It was stuck on the Home Screen but still had the "Un Lock image " on it. And for anyone that uses Android products that's NOT suppose to happen . And For sure not on the 3rd day using it.I read the reviews first and thought it was a good purchase for my mother since she will just use it for Facebook and may be shopping (when she learns how... LOL ) but it was mistake. Had to return it and get refund, now im going to get the Google nexus instead and im sure that would be better.Maybe i just had a bad one,  it unfortunate though kinda disappointed.
Reviews.Title: **Froze After Second Day of Using It **

Reviews.Content: The tablet was just what we were looking for..It was purchased for my 101 yr old mother! She needed a larger screen (she was using a 7") to make reading easier, keeping up with her facebook family,etc. the tablet isn't as fast as others but perfect for her - at her age she doesn't need fast!! It wes in perfect condition, looked brand new. We are very happy with it....BJ Love

Reviews.Content: i am happy with my le pan . I am not very  good with computers so i have a lot to learn. I have to have my gran kids help me. But practice make it easier.

Reviews.Content: What a fabulous product. Everything you need from a Laptop, but the convenience of a Tablet with the touch screen.
Reviews.Title: Fabulous PC Touch Tablet

Reviews.Author: John T. Uhas
Reviews.Content: It's been so long since I returned it that I can't remember why I didn't like it.  I know that it wouldn't let me watch some videos I wanted to watch from Network sites, and couldn't be used for Hulu.
Reviews.Title: not for me

Reviews.Author: Shannon Cook
Reviews.Content: I am not one to write reviews but I have had so many problems with this device and cannot seem to get any help from Le Pan. 90% of the time the volume button does not work and even if I try to manually turn up the sound, it stays on mute. Also, it freezes a lot the time and I cannot access Netflix or Hulu. I submitted a help request on the Le Pan website on 11/29 to try and get help with these issues. I have also tried calling them on multiple occasions, only to wait on hold for 30+ minutes and have the call just drop, no one from Le Pan ever answers. Finally, on December 13th I received an update on my website inquiry stating "NEED TO CONTACT NETFLIX NOT LE PAN". Which answers the netflix issue but not the freezing or volume issues. Maybe they are just busy from the holidays but to make someone wait two weeks and then not respond to all issues is unacceptable.Basically, this is now just a  very expensive e-reader as I cannot access anything else and cannot get any support from Le Pan.
Reviews.Title: Awful customer service/multiple problems with device

Reviews.Author: Ernestbrandy
Reviews.Content: The Le pan tablet is crap im not really one to leave comments but a month after using it, it froze and wont come on. And you have to email them and they'll take another month to reply to ur email since their customer number doesnt work. If you dont want to be full of regrets save more money and buy a popular brand where customer service can attend to u. I have tried everything it still wont come on and i'm still wanting for their email
Reviews.Title: Worst tablet ever

Reviews.Author: Jonathan Newman
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: I have now had three solid months of use out of the LePan. I have had NO PROBLEMS with it other than some of my dislikes from my ealier post.Since writing my initial post, my son (3 years old) watched movies which we transfered over from our computer for much of our 10 hour trip to Ireland (waiting in airports and flights) and it still had about 30% battery life with no additional charging needed. I am sure running wifi and bluetooth would significantly reduce this. Looking for a cheap tablet for entertainment and that you don't mind your kids using, this is one way to go.I have found the apps in the android market for word processing are a little clunky and unfortunatley as a teacher in a school that uses Microsoft Word, the interchange is not so smooth all the time. I can work much quicker (editing, creating, inserting tables, diagrams, etc) using my Lenovo ThinkPad and therefore have not actually used the tablet for work.Initial Reivew (First Few Weeks):Picked this up as a Cyber Monday Week deal from Amazon ($150). Purchased this for more of an entertainment tablet, but still to do a little work email/word processing, etc. Price went back up to $250. I would imagine price will keep dropping after December.Pros:- Cost- Netflix, Facebook, and other apps work great- Came with ICS installed- Easy work around to download and install Adobe Flash Player- Solid build for a cheap tablet- Bluetooth and wifi works as good if not better than my iphone 4, no problems so far as others report.- Easy connection to computer through bluetooth direct connect and also through supplied transfer cable.-Not good/Not Bad:- Battery Life (not the same as other tablets, but I adjusted the setting and can get 6 hours or so of heavy use -- wifi, websurfing, bluetooth (keyboard), netflix and email no problem. But for my needs, I can't imagine needing 6 hours of heavy use very often with out being able to plug in and charge.Cons:- No USB port for plugging in keyboard, USB flash drive, etc. (This was big for me, but have quickly gotten use to the fact that I need to use work arounds).- Tablet WON'T charge connected to USB port in computer.- Hard to find case (see below) and the cases I could find were more expensive compared to same brand for ipad.- Costly replacement cable, planning on being very careful of mine.Note: BEWARE of keyboard/case combinations that Amazon links with the LePan. I read many reviews before buying and many of them either do not work or need modifications. I purchased the Kensington Universal Pro Keyfolio (bluetooth) case and keyboard. A little costly but I have been very happy with this addition. Had it set up in minutes and my tablet works great with all ports/buttons open while fitting snug in the tabs. Maybe not as snug as other brands, but I have not had any slippage or felt uncomfortable with it. It is also easy to pop out when you want just the tablet. Highly recommend this purchase with the LePan.
Reviews.Title: Good For Price

Reviews.Author: DigityDad
Reviews.Content: First off, I have had this unit for almost a year.  Bought last January so this is a pretty long-term test.  I would have written a more flattering review in the first month but problem is over time I have had to invest a fair amount of time to keep the unit stable and working.  I don't have that kind of time anymore and find when I need it, it's either not connected to wifi, or has turned itself on and is dead.I'm sure there are fixes for these things if I invest a lot of personal time in the forums which provide a lot of detail, but as I say I don't have the time anymore.That said, I did get some good use out of it, and it was very inexpensive so I can't complain.  And now it has a second live as a wifi picture frame that automatically downloads pics from my Picasa "best of" album (so long as I connect it to wifi every now and then).  This is a pretty good use in itself given similar wifi digital frames the same size are the often more expensive.
Reviews.Title: A good value.  Just not as reliable as I would like.

Reviews.Author: Deloachw
Reviews.Content: I purchased my TC970 last November from another website. I was very pleased at first. The tablet did everything I wanted it to do. Seven months later the tablet stopped booting. It would just get stuck on the startup screen and stay there. I contacted support and tried all suggestions as well as some I found online. Nothing worked. I then went through the lengthy RMA process and got a replacement refurbed tablet. The replacement tablet is far more glitchy than my original tablet. The battery lasts half as long and the tablet freezes and has to be reset several times a day. It also drops the Wi-Fi connection frequently when it goes into standby mode. I hope the replacement tablet lasts longer than the seven months of my first tablet, but we will see. I would suggest possibly looking at the Google Nexus 7 before buying this tablet.
Reviews.Title: Was very happy at first, but...

Reviews.Author: Breanna
Reviews.Content: Worst purchase I have made in a while. I am actually on my second Le Pan because the first one froze up within 2 days and couldn't be reset. Amazon was wonderful about the return! This tablet freezes all of the time, when you touch the screen it often won't recognize that you did, it seems to have difficulty picking up a wireless signal no matter how strong it is. Apps like my email and facebook never seem to work correctly and facebook never seems to be able to retrieve notificaions. I bought this because I'm  backpackng through Central and South America and wanted something light weight I could use to keep up with friends and Skype but the camera is so terrible that they can hardly see me and the sound in both directions is so muffled that we're constantly saying 'What?'. The one positive is that the battery seems to be pretty ok so far, not great but ok. If I weren't in Panama, I would be trying to get my money back. Unless you're only using it to play solitare, it will be useless, and even then I wouldn't be too sure.
Reviews.Title: Spend the money and get ANYTHING else

Reviews.Author: J. Barnes "A part time reader, and full time ...
Reviews.Content: This Android Tablet is quite amazing. It works well with Apps, has the memory to handle all the work load, and can play movies with ease. The only thing is that it will freeze when its loaded with a lot of programs running at once. If you use it one thing at a time, and carefully, it works like clock work!Pro: Speed, basic tablet, and can handle the load of AppsCon: Can freeze when challenged with a lot of programs going on at once.
Reviews.Title: Its a very decent tablet!

Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant about the Lepan I read about freeze ups but that is a no issue. It works better than I could have expected. Great product at a great price.
Reviews.Title: Great product

Reviews.Content: Good! I recommend this tablet, cheap and has the same android apps of the phones and can read your ebooks
Reviews.Title: GOOD!

Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet and it was just ok. I'm still trying to figure out how to update it to ice cream sandwich. Every time I do so it freezes up on me or it just stops mid way through.
Reviews.Title: Good for the money

Reviews.Author: Burnt toast
Reviews.Content: after hassling with this thing for three days I finally sent it back and haven't considered a tablet since. word
Reviews.Title: Didn't work.

Reviews.Author: john h
Reviews.Content: 7/21/12 Purchased7/27/12 received8/05/12 started to freeze up8/06/12 stopped working8/09/12 Called Amazon they would send a new unit8/15/12 received new unit10/19/12 no power up at all, completely dead10/22/12 Amazon said it is out of warranty. "POS"10/22/12 Called LE PAN Customer service, was disconnected 3 timesjust through in trash.Don't do it, just buy a good 1.
Reviews.Title: RUN AWAY DON'T DO IT

Reviews.Author: V M
Reviews.Content: This tablet is a great product for the money, especially with the ICS upgrade. I am a techie so I had no problems upgrading, I might even root this device later if needed. I got to install Flash through the .apk file and that works great too. It works great with a bluetooh wireless keyboard too.Only wish if the device drivers were signed by the company. It's kinda suspicious looking that these aren't signed, so I ran a system wide malware-virus scan after I installed them and even pre-scanned them before installation. Nothing found, but it's more professional to have signed distributions.Also, having a USB port would be nice (besides to 30-pin to USB) and a better camera than the 2MP.Overall, would recommend this to anyone looking for value for money.
Reviews.Title: Great product for the money

Reviews.Author: SAM
Reviews.Content: Ok! I got this tablet two days back and I am amazed..simply amazed how good it is! Smooth flow of UI..never lags up ..runs video. I was so skeptical after I ordered it since I read negative reviews about tablet shutting down and not working thereafter and problems latching to wifi. But I didn't face any such problems. I upgraded to ICS and it was breeze. Let me tell you I have two laptops,one china made cheap tab and one samsung galaxy 7'' wifi. The china made tab that i had earlier was a piece of junk so when I ordered lepan 2 , i thought I am making same mistake again but NO!!!! It was way beyond my expectation.I took this because 7'' screen was too small for me at work. But this one is just perfect. The resolution is just mind blowing its as good as an ipad only less expensive. I should thank le pan guys for making technology affordable. It snapy fast, leaves even my galaxy tab far behind which has a 1 Gig of processor.Only minor flaw is the volume rocker ..too flat to identify it. A USB port would have been a added bonus. However with the price tage of just $279 it's a steal.A must buy !!!
Reviews.Title: Amazing!! Must Buy- Value for Money

Reviews.Author: old guys rule
Reviews.Content: I've had the Lepan II tablet for about 2 months now and have nothing but praise for it.  Out of the box it was very easy to use. The quality is excellent. It is a great product for the price.  For the price I don't think you can do any better. I'm still waiting for the IceCream Sandwhich upgrade to become available - hopefully that will happen soon.  I looked at many tablets available in this price range and decided on the LePan II after reading the many reviews that give the device a high reputation. You can spend more but I'm not sure it's worth it.
Reviews.Title: This is a very good tablet

Reviews.Author: Theosts
Reviews.Content: I have had the Lepan 2 about 2 months now, so I think I have run it through it's paces enough to give a good review. My Lepan 2 was delivered in about 4 days so no issues with waiting. The tablet came with V118 version firmware already installed. I have had no problems with wifi connections and have tried at about 5 different locations with various types of routers. All apps I have installed seem to work fine. I did have to reinstall Skype once because the video did not work first time around.I added a 32 gb sd card (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004G60AD6/ref=oh_details_o06_s00_i00) which works out fine for adding movies, music and pictures. The LePan 2 does not allow apps to be loaded on the extra sd card however, or maybe I just have not figured out how to do this yet.I bought the Targus case (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B005BZNE1Q/ref=oh_details_o00_s00_i00) which works great, but is a little thick and heavy. I use it around the house, but when traveling I use a very simple neoprene Ipad sleeve I got on Ebay for 4 bucks.As a screen protector I use this: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B003D8GAA0/ref=oh_details_o04_s00_i00. It comes with three protectors that do need some trimming. The protector does apply very easily without bubbles as long as you clean the screen very well with the cleaning cloth that comes with the Lepan. The protector is quite thick but I have not noticed any delays on the touch screen after adding this.All in all I have thoroughly enjoyed the LePan 2 tablet so far to browse the internet, watch movies and TV shows online, stream Netflix, Pandora and play some games I found on the Google Marketplace. If you are in doubt, give it a chance. It's a great tablet for the price.Update July 5, 2012:I just returned from a two and a half week vacation in Germany and France with the Le Pan 2. The LP2 worked on all wifi routers I tried with no problems. I was able to keep up on emails, FB, etc without a problem. I'm still very glad I bought it!
Reviews.Title: Works as advertised

Reviews.Author: Mariah
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet on the HSN channel on TV and I was so happy and excited when I got it because I won't be having a computer after today so I was gonna use that as my computer. 6 days after turning it on and it froze completely and I can't do anything on it now. Before today, I actually liked it better than the iPad but now I don't recommend buying and getting your hopes up. Also, some things to keep in mind when buying it, you can't video chat on it. I downloaded Skype and tried video calling my brother's iPod touch via Skype but you can only call them like you would on a cell phone and even then the mic sucks. The camera also isn't very good. The only solution I can think of to getting my LePan tablet to work again is pushing the tiny reset button on the back and restoring it to the original settings but even then I might run into this problem again and I would rather just send it back than dealing with the hassle of resetting it all the time. So sad and disappointed :(
Reviews.Title: Worked amazingly at first but now it froze.

Reviews.Author: arto4ever "arto"
Reviews.Content: the screen looks great and all but when you wanna watch any you tube video the image pauses several times during a video even when i have an excellent Wi-fi signal .  other than that is good for the price.
Reviews.Title: choppy YouTube videos!

Reviews.Author: mamasloan
Reviews.Content: Received LePan early March.  Was quite impressed until it died after about 3 days and after dealing with customer service to reset factory settings because of Wifi problems.  Was told it was defective and to send to LePan.  They received it March 15th and it took them 6 weeks to send a replacement.  Kept checking status every week or so and was told they were backlogged processing RMAs (returns)....how many returns did they have?!!?  I told them their internal problems were not the customer's problems.  Why would a company share that info with customers?I've had the replacement about 2 weeks and so far so good.  I hope there are no more problems because I don't want to have to send it back and wait another 6 weeks while they get their act together.I gave them only 3 stars because of their lack of customer service.  If you don't experience any problems with the tablet it's a nice product for the money.FYI.....forget about their "hotline" because the most you'll receive is a recording.  I had even complained to Amazon and they couldn't get through either.  Need to go to their website and communicate via their Support.Will update if I have anymore problems.
Reviews.Title: REPLACEMENT good so far

Reviews.Author: Riv3r
Reviews.Content: Upon activating the tablet after it's been in standby mode for a while, the touchscreen becomes essentially non-functional for several minutes.  For example, after activating from standby and reaching the unlock screen with a pattern, I tried numerous times trying to swipe the correct pattern.  However, for some reason, the touchscreen would never "maintain" the line I tried drawing while swiping over the circles.  The line would always "breakup" before I could finish the pattern for 4 circles.  It seemed to be skipping from one circle to the next without any continuous connection.  This happened for about 5 minutes, until it finally read my finger swipe correctly and unlocked.  Frustrated, I decided to try a password lock instead of a pattern.  So I put the tablet on standby for a while, reactivated it, and tried putting in my password via the keyboard.  However, whenever I pressed a key, it would read it as double, sometimes even triple (e.g. pressing the 'd' key once, would result in 'dd' or 'ddd' being entered into the password field).  This happened with all the other keys I pressed, and continued for several minutes, until it stopped doing it all of a sudden and was finally able to put in my password.  Frustrated again, I turned off any lock.However, not being able to control the unlock screen with finger swipes wasn't the only issue after returning from standby.  Whenever I tried to use pdfs after returning from a long standby, I could not control scrolling or zooming.  Anytime I tried scrolling, it would zoom in and out.  This would continue for several minutes until it would finally function normally.So it's pretty clear that with my tablet, something happens to the touchscreen functionality after it's been in standby for a while.  I always had to wait several minutes after activating from standby for the touchscreen to work properly.  The touchscreen keyboard must be "reloading" during that time, or something.  But yea, this is unacceptable for me.  I tried doing a factory reset as well as downloading the new firmware, but it still kept giving me the same problem.  I really wanted to enjoy this tablet since everything else works decently, but this one major flaw with the touchscreen has led me to return this tablet.I've been anti-Apple for the longest time, but after trying out the ipad 3 and its retina display, I think I may take the plunge and get it.  I had narrowed my tablet choices to only 4:3 format because my main uses are reading pdfs, textbooks, and magazines, and it looks like the ipad is the only other option out there.  Also, that retina display makes pdfs look amazing, especially small font on documents.  I had considered the Coby Kyros Android 4.0 with the 9.7 inch screen, but the negative reviews turned me off to it.It's possible that it was just my Le Pan 2 touchscreen that was defective, so hopefully you future purchasers of this tablet don't run into the same problem.
Reviews.Title: Major problem with touchscreen after activating from standby...

Reviews.Author: Lana
Reviews.Content: It's quite  a nice device and it became even better after I managed to make it work with bluetooth keyboard :)
Reviews.Title: Good as a first tablet PC

Reviews.Author: Constant Researcher
Reviews.Content: I researched this tablet and suggested "we" buy this tablet for my niece's children for Christmas. We all pitched in and made it a nice Santa gift.  She bought two and liked them for a time.  In January, I purchased one myself and like it very much.  The problem is that this item freezes quite regularly and I don't know why, which means constant resetting.  My nephew's tablet had to be returned to LePan for service last month, after 3 months of use. A month later, it is still not back from the manufacturer.  Calling this company is very hard to get through to -- actually almost impossible.  The times that we did get through we were told they were totally backed up.  I'm not sure I like the sounds of that.  We now have a total of 3 of these units in our family and we did purchase the Square Trade warranty, but they only kick in after the LePan warranty expires.  For the money, I still like my unit, but am unhappy with the repair service my nephew received, and since I am the one who  did the research and suggested this, I feel badly about it.  He is a 12-year-old boy who really missed his tablet for a month.  My review would have been higher had I not had this experience with inability to contact the company after needing service shortly after purchase. I think most of us know that customer service can make or break a company no matter how good a product is.  More accessability to this company would have helped my rating immensely. Thanks.September 3,  2012I really hate to give bad reviews to any company trying to make competitive products in this market.  However,  this is probably one of the worst purchases i have made.  As noted,  we have 3 in the family and they have all been sent back once and need to go back again at the cost of $15 in postage everytime. If there were a class action suit against these tablets I would join it.  I can not even turn the tablet on unless I stick a pin in the reset hole so now iI keep a safety pin with my case! I find this as good as throwing $230 into the garbage disposal.
Reviews.Title: Good and Bad

Reviews.Author: vmurphy03
Reviews.Content: I first saw the Le pan on HSN and was impressed by the presentation, and the 5 payments of $50 and change!  I don't have a smart phone and won't have one for awhile, until my Verizon contract is up lol and have been interested in a tablet.  This got my attention so I ordered it!  I really like it- it's fun.  I think it's not for high-tech people, but for us just getting into the tablet game at a price we can afford.  I can do what I want to do on it-watch youtube, tv, netflix, play around with apps, etc, in any room of my house because of the wifi and if I ever feel like taking advantage of the front-facing camera there are possibilities like Skype and chat.  I'm new to Android so it's been a learning experience!Le Pan TC 970 9.7-Inch Multi-Touch LCD Google Android Tablet PC
Reviews.Title: I like it!

Reviews.Author: Alvy Singer
Reviews.Content: As of writing, this tablet now supports CyanogenMod7, which is Android 2.3. (Gingerbread). By contrast, the stock ROM comes with Android 2.2 (Froyo), which is still acceptable but obviously suboptimal for a tablet that can run something better. A brief Google search will get you started. I was able to switch everything over in about an hour.Second, the battery life for this thing is amazing. I charge it so infrequently that I'm often taken aback by how much power it's not using in between charges. I can't even remember the last time I had to plug it in, though I tend to charge it up anyway just in case the zombie apocalypse happens while I'm at work and I need to locate safe houses on my way to the capitol or something. Anyway, if you're looking for a tablet that can do better than "maybe 6 hours on a single charge if you're lucky", this is the way to go.Other pros include surprisingly powerful speakers, good Wi-fi reception even with a low signal, an acceptable screen for the price, and so on. Although I wouldn't say it's designed specifically to be ergonomic, it's still comfortable to hold. Pretend it's a Dualshock for maximum grip comfort.Not much to say when it comes to negatives. Since it's not Honeycomb, actual made-for-tablet-app support is somewhat spotty. About half of my apps notice it's a tablet anyway. The other half just run in regular mode. I've yet to have this be a big issue, but I do wish I could use all the new tablet apps out there. Other than that, the glossy screen smudges easily, which is what you signed up for when you get a tablet in general I suppose. Customer service is limited from what I hear, although it's not like Android is really complicated enough to warrant its necessity. Overall, no dealbreakers, but some downsides.Note to those who bought this, I've found Acase Premium Leather Slimline Carrying Case for Apple iPad and HP TouchPad (Black) to be the best choice for a case. Fits perfectly, power button remains open for use, etc.
Reviews.Title: Exceptional budget tablet.

Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this tablet. I bought it as a gift for my grandson. It is a very good value for the money. The screen is bright and it is the perfect size.  I just don't understand why anyone chooses to ship with USPS. The shipping is slow. It was very well packaged.
Reviews.Title: Good Value

Reviews.Author: athorn
Reviews.Content: Very nice design and fun to use but the screen started freezing on the 2nd day I had it. I called the manufactor and was told to stick a pin in the reset hole. This works but after 1 month of use the tablet continues to freeze randomly. I had the same problem with my Android phone, so maybe this is an Android problem and not specific to this tablet, or maybe not.
Reviews.Title: Nice tablet but freezes

Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: I'm very disappointed with this product! I purchased 3 of these for Christmas, 1 of them worked. I had to return 2 of them for replacement. I had to wait about 2 weeks because they were out of stock. When I received the replacements, they were defective as well. I had no choice, I returned the two tablets. When I got the credit, I was charged 20%? Not a good experience! Can anyone tell me how I can dispute the 20% charge, and what are the chances of me getting it back? thx dave
Reviews.Title: Dissatisfied Customer

Reviews.Author: J. Brown "jaydub"
Reviews.Content: I've had mine for about 24 hrs now and must say i'm overall pleased. This is my first tablet (never owned a smart phone either) so I don't have anything to compare it to other than briefly playing with friends tablets a few times, android OS a little more difficult to use than I anticipated but I'm getting there. Issues I've encountered so far are: bluetooth has been dropping in and out when enabled, can't get the vpn to install on campus but picks up my wireless network at home fine( I even took it to my tech buddy today and he couldn't set up the vpn either), power button is a little hard to press (not a big deal), a pdf e-book I have is hard to read, but I may just be missing how to make the adjustments. I'm hoping some of those issues will be resolved once I learn how to use it and possibly talk to tech support. On the flipside, the responsiveness is good, nice screen, nice build, I've had no issues connecting to Wifi as others here have reported. Overall I'm satisfied.Will make an update if anything changes.
Reviews.Title: Le Pan ii, a good deal so far

Reviews.Author: azmtrepair
Reviews.Content: I got it from amazon and it worked great for about 2 weeks and than I lost all info on day and i cant  get it to connect to the internet at all I cant get hold of customer service  so Ill send it back to Amazon and  get a differant  kind I guess  Lepan  tablet isnt worth the head aches
Reviews.Title: bad  tablet

Reviews.Author: Melissa Lanner "M.Lanner"
Reviews.Content: I love my le pan ii. Too bad it doesn't play hulu.com since hulu recognizes as a mobile device n wants u to use hulu plus but oh well. Netflix & YouTube apps are awesome. Syncs to gmail just fineNo problems with the wifi as previously discussed. Battery life, use airplane mode when not in use, make sure to not leave it idle. Keyboard response time is excellent. Micro sd slot is plus too! So glad I didn't purchase the Ipad. Just a reminder this is a tablet!
Reviews.Title: Le Pan II

Reviews.Author: MC Hammer "MC"
Reviews.Content: 3 months after purchase, the tablet doesn't turn on anymore. It started the same day the claim guaranty from amazon run out... I will try to contact the seller but do not expect much from them after all the bad comments I read here...
Reviews.Title: cheap piece of crap

Reviews.Author: le pan
Reviews.Content: i wouldn't suggest this i would hold out for a better one i play on my wife's kindle fire and it runs so much smoother there is no comparison. Yes the screen is smaller but i have had to reset mine a whole bunch and it runs slow sometimes and it also randomly searches or the keyboard screen will come up in the middle of a game and a few other things that doesn't make it the best buy.
Reviews.Title: good at first

Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: This tablet is great!  It does everything my phone does except make phone calls of course. Perfect when you're on the go. I am very satisfied
Reviews.Title: very nice

Reviews.Author: P. Campbell
Reviews.Content: I just received my Le Pan II yesterday and at first my wifi worked perfectly and connected with no problem. Today...it was a different story. I have not been able to use my le pan ALL day. I cant get it to connect to my internet. All it keeps saying is "obtaining IP address" and then just when it says" remembered" it goes right back to trying to obtain the address again. It is so frustrating. But overall when I could connect to the internet it worked great. Nice screen and speed. I have been searching in the threads to find the fix for the wifi but its a lot to read through.I would definitely recommend this tablet to those of you who are on a budget and need a nice tablet.*UPDATE*Well after hours of trying to figure It out....I disabled the security on my router,  reset it, restarted my computer and tada! It connected! Problem...there is no security on my router. I'm afraid to enable security on it it my not connect again! I'm gonna Google how to set up an IP static address for my tablet. Thanks everyone for your comments and help.*UPDATE March 5th*Well I just ended up buying a new router over the weekend, a Netgear. Worked perfectly!! Connected with no problem whatsoever!! Now I can't put my Le Pan down..loving it.
Reviews.Title: Love it...but wifi is seriously irritating me.

Reviews.Author: andy
Reviews.Content: I purchashed this item like 2 days ago but too bad i must return it. First, this tablet freeze like crazy!! It has been frozen on me for more then 5 times sincr i got the tablet so i thought mine was defected but when i looked at the reviews from other people, apparently they are all experiencing the same problem. I say this tablet is not too bad for only 200 bucks but if you dont mind carrying a tooth pick on you all the time so that you could reset the tablet when it freezes, go for it and buy it. Btw im writing this review with the tc 970 right now and i have to say its pretty bad, the touchscreen is not to accurate so i had to keep pressing thedelete button and you have to tap quite hard as well.
Reviews.Title: great tablet

Reviews.Author: Ronald L. Pierce "Big E"
Reviews.Content: First tablet PC i have own. Works very good so far. Had the unit for a month now. It does freeze up sometimes but that's no problem since it has a reset button. Very fast, does what i need it to. Going to take it to church today and use it as my Bible since it already has a Bible app install. The Bible app has many Bibles on it and you can download a version for off line use when WiFi is not possible .. Like the big screen, and the weight is about 1.6 pounds.  I did not buy this from Amazon, this is not a knock on Amazon but the price where i bought it was so much cheaper at the time i bought it . Most place wanted around $249.00 and i got this for a $198.00 great price. Update. Had this tablet now almost 2 years and it has held up very well. No problems with it.
Reviews.Title: le pan tc 970

Reviews.Author: Amazon Lover
Reviews.Content: I can't tell you how pleased we are with this tablet.  This was a Christmas present for my teenage son.  He loves it! :) I love it!It does take a little getting used too, but it didn't take but a day of playing around with this tablet to know the ins and outs of how it works.I am very impressed with the GPS feature and the Talk Google feature.  The Picture and Sound is incredible!  I am able to listen to Youtube videos.  I did download Look Out Security  & Adobe Flash -  2 very MUST HAVE apps toProtect your Tablet  & Adobe Flash to get the most out of your tablet Pc.I wasn't able to do the update, but everything was working just fine.  I spoke with Customer Service (Very Friendly, and Quick Response the couple times I had spoke and emailed them) Customer Service said there wasno reason for me to do the update if it was working fine.  I agree, its been working just fine.I downloaded several apps for my son, so he could actually start using it right away on Christmas Day.I did discover that I had Yahoo Messenger and Facebook both running in the background and I didn't realize that, and it made my mic stop working.  I went into the settings and stopped running those 2 apps (which I thought I had already closed) Turned the Tablet off and back on, and the mic has worked fine every since.  My son downloadedSkype and Skyped with his Friends.The case Amazon had suggested that go with this Tablet,(  10.2" Synthetic Leather Case with Keyboard and Stylus Pen for ePad and aPad (Black)) didn't work. Honestly, I had ordered this together with the tablet per Amazon's suggestion, if I would have known how good the virtual keyboard that is built right in the tablet worked, I wouldn't have bothered going with amazon suggestion to purchase with this tablet.Amazon (since it was their suggestion and error)Amazon Fully Refunded my money, and Thanks to some Previous Reviewers (Thank You)  I discovered this Tablet cover works nicely with this tablet:However, I still strongly suggest a Case to Protect your tablet:  (this one works Fabulous with this tablet)The Case that Does Work with this Tablet is:Targus Truss Leather Carrying Case with Stand for Apple iPad 16GB, 32GB, 64GB WiFi and WiFi + 3G THZ022US (Black/Turquoise Interior)http://www.amazon.com/Targus-Carrying-THZ022US-Turquoise-Interior/dp/B003VANVB6/ref=sr_1_1?s=electronics&ie;=UTF8&qid;=1325843718&sr;=1-1It is a fingerprint magnet.  So, I have on order a Screen protector and some stylus pens to help with this :)For $198 (that is the cost around Thanksgiving) We were pleased! :)I was so impressed, I ordered a LePan II for myself, Glad I preordered for $262 for the LePan II - I see it went up to around $300.  Looking forward to my LePan II coming next week, and I will review and post about that one too!You will NOT be DISAPPOINTED with this TABLET!  In my opinion it does 99% what an IPAD does but hundreds of dollars cheapier!
Reviews.Title: AWESOME TABLET!!!

Reviews.Author: StuBDue
Reviews.Content: When picking up this tablet, you can tell it is built well. The screen is gorgeous and this tablet is fast. You can find screen protectors and some cases to fit it. There are actually some things I like about it better than the iPad 1 I had but being a Mac guy I get frustrated by the hoops you have to jump thru to sync music, etc. It does occasionally freeze but a simple reset is quick. I don't think the speakers are as bad as many have stated. Support so far has been good and prices for extra cables, etc is reasonable. I bought this thinking I would try it and return it but I have decided to keep it .... $199 at Big Lots.
